d0715430-18f5-409d-ab02-5c06336aaefc In a small saucepan, add the dried herbs to the water and bring to a boil—Cook for 5 minutes. Over a bowl pour the water through a strainer to remove the herbs and leave the water to cool to room temperature. Discard the herbs.
d0715430-18f5-409d-ab02-5c06336aaefc In a large bowl, knead the salt into the butter with your hands. Add the strained, cooled water and continue kneading the mixture to ensure all of the butter is making contact with the water.
d0715430-18f5-409d-ab02-5c06336aaefc Strain the water from the butter, squeezing the butter to remove any excess. Place the butter in a clean glass or ceramic jar, pressing and packing it down to ensure there are no air pockets. Cover the jar.
d0715430-18f5-409d-ab02-5c06336aaefc Leave the jar undisturbed in a cool, dark place (a cupboard is fine) for 30 days, or longer if you prefer more pungency. After opening, store the smen in the refrigerator.
b6ac8e3d-5e73-42c7-ac6d-c28baa9c46e1 Ahead of time, place the dried fava beans in a large bowl and cover with a generous amount of cold water. Set aside to soak overnight or all day.
b6ac8e3d-5e73-42c7-ac6d-c28baa9c46e1 When ready to cook, drain the beans and peel them if they weren't already skinned and split.
b6ac8e3d-5e73-42c7-ac6d-c28baa9c46e1 Transfer the peeled fava beans to a medium-sized pot and cover with a generous amount of water. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium and simmer the beans until tender, one hour or longer.
b6ac8e3d-5e73-42c7-ac6d-c28baa9c46e1 Drain the beans, reserving the liquid.
b6ac8e3d-5e73-42c7-ac6d-c28baa9c46e1 Transfer the drained beans to a food processor, and add the garlic, olive oil, lemon juice, two tablespoons of the reserved liquid, and spices. Process on high speed until smooth, adding additional liquid if necessary to thin the bessara. At a minimum, it should be thin enough to pour out onto a plate, but may be thinned even more if a soup-like consistency is preferred.
b6ac8e3d-5e73-42c7-ac6d-c28baa9c46e1 Taste the bessara and adjust the seasoning as desired.
b6ac8e3d-5e73-42c7-ac6d-c28baa9c46e1 Reheat the bessara and serve warm, preferably in a warm dish so that the bessara doesn't cool rapidly.
b6ac8e3d-5e73-42c7-ac6d-c28baa9c46e1 Garnish with any of the following: ground cumin, paprika, salt, harissa or cayenne, olive oil, and/or chopped parsley.
f914574e-1455-4939-acdc-34925fc852bb Scrub the zucchini, but do not peel them. Cut off the ends, and chop the zucchini into tiny cubes.
f914574e-1455-4939-acdc-34925fc852bb Place the cubed zucchini in a pot with the olive oil, garlic, spices, and water. Cover and cook over medium heat stirring occasionally, for about 7 to 8 minutes, or until the zucchini are crisp-tender.
f914574e-1455-4939-acdc-34925fc852bb Add the lemon juice, parsley, and cumin and continue simmering, uncovered, until the liquids have reduced and the zucchini is tender but not mushy. Taste, and adjust the seasoning if desired.
f914574e-1455-4939-acdc-34925fc852bb Serve warm or cold. Cooked zucchini salad can be eaten as a dip, or served with a fork or spoon.
5bfbb64e-8e97-4870-b8a8-57cd7c2f9bd6 Place the tomatoes, garlic, and peppers in a heavy-bottomed 3-quart saucepan.
5bfbb64e-8e97-4870-b8a8-57cd7c2f9bd6 Set over medium heat and cook, uncovered, for 20 minutes, stirring frequently with a spoon.
5bfbb64e-8e97-4870-b8a8-57cd7c2f9bd6 When the vegetables are nice and soft, add the oil, paprika, salt, and pepper.
5bfbb64e-8e97-4870-b8a8-57cd7c2f9bd6 Cook, stirring frequently, for another 10 minutes.
5bfbb64e-8e97-4870-b8a8-57cd7c2f9bd6 When the mixture is well blended and most of the liquid has evaporated, the matbucha is ready.
5bfbb64e-8e97-4870-b8a8-57cd7c2f9bd6 Cool and store in a covered container in the refrigerator.
4532320f-29a7-405a-895b-40a36b4ec89d Soak the olives in a bowl of water for a few hours or overnight; drain. (Or, if the olives are hard, soften them by soaking in boiling water for 15 minutes.) For better infusion of the marinade, make one or two small incisions in each olive (or gently crush them to crack the flesh of the olive).
4532320f-29a7-405a-895b-40a36b4ec89d While the olives are soaking, make the harissa if it's not already prepared:
4532320f-29a7-405a-895b-40a36b4ec89d Seed the preserved lemon and cut it into thin strips.
4532320f-29a7-405a-895b-40a36b4ec89d Combine the preserved lemon with the drained olives, parsley. lemon juice and as much harissa as desired.
4532320f-29a7-405a-895b-40a36b4ec89d If you like, a little additional olive oil or garlic can be mixed in to the olives.
4532320f-29a7-405a-895b-40a36b4ec89d Cover and refrigerate for six to eight hours (overnight is best) before serving.
952af4b2-a059-4a52-b9aa-0f5bf4319149 Preheat your oven to 375 F / 190 C. Wash the almonds if they feel gritty (they usually are in Morocco) and drain.
952af4b2-a059-4a52-b9aa-0f5bf4319149 Spread the almonds on a baking pan and roast for about 15 minutes, longer if necessary, until the almonds are crunchy and darkened but not burnt.
952af4b2-a059-4a52-b9aa-0f5bf4319149 Allow the almonds to cool a bit and then pass them through a meat grinder several times to make a smooth, oily-looking paste. Or, grind the toasted almonds to a paste in a food processor on high speed.
952af4b2-a059-4a52-b9aa-0f5bf4319149 Be sure to continue processing until the almonds grind to a glistening, the smooth mass that can almost be poured. This can take several minutes.
952af4b2-a059-4a52-b9aa-0f5bf4319149 Next, gradually blend the argan oil into the almond paste, a spoonful at a time or in a very slow trickle. You can do this by hand stirring vigorously, or preferably with the food processor on the lowest speed. Use only as much argan oil as you need to to make the amlou as thick or thin as you like.
952af4b2-a059-4a52-b9aa-0f5bf4319149 Next, gradually add the warm honey, sugar, and salt in the same manner. Taste the amlou and adjust the sweetness if desired.
952af4b2-a059-4a52-b9aa-0f5bf4319149 Serve amlou on a plate or shallow dish with bread for dipping.
d3b26f34-37dc-4ec5-abeb-d738f7cd5ab8 Mix the ground meat with the onion and spices. Melt the butter in a large skillet or frying pan and add the ground meat. Cook over medium heat, stirring to break up the meat into fine pieces until the meat is well browned and thoroughly cooked.
d3b26f34-37dc-4ec5-abeb-d738f7cd5ab8 Stir in the parsley and the three eggs, and cook over medium-high heat just until the liquids are absorbed. You should be able to pack and mold the meat. Set the kefta filling aside.
d3b26f34-37dc-4ec5-abeb-d738f7cd5ab8 Fold the briouats. See How to Fold Briouats. With scissors, cut the pastry dough into strips about two-and-a-half inches wide. Place a single strip of warqa or spring roll wrapper – or two layered strips of phyllo dough – on your work surface. (If the strip of warqa is less than 10 inches long, use two layers.) Lightly brush butter on the bottom two-thirds of the dough. Place a large tablespoon of filling towards the bottom of the strip, and fold the bottom up to enclose the filling.
d3b26f34-37dc-4ec5-abeb-d738f7cd5ab8 Fold the bottom left corner of the enclosed dough upwards to the right, aligning it with the right edge of the strip. Then flip the bottom right corner upwards to the left, aligning it with the left edge of the dough. You should see a triangle take shape. Continue folding the triangle, flipping right and then left in this manner, until you reach the end of the dough.
d3b26f34-37dc-4ec5-abeb-d738f7cd5ab8 Trim any excess length off the edge of the dough, dab it with a little egg yolk, and tuck the end of the dough into the "pocket" formed by the open edge of dough on the briouat. You can use the tip of a butter knife or your scissors to help tuck in the flap of dough.
d3b26f34-37dc-4ec5-abeb-d738f7cd5ab8 Cook or freeze the briouats. Deep fry the briouats in hot oil until light golden brown. Drain and serve. Briouats stay warm for a long time, but if frying them well in advance of serving, you can reheat them in a 350 degree F oven for five to 10 minutes.
67d9fbbc-d40a-4dd9-a0fa-fd5d0bd1f9c4 Rinse the olives and remove the pits. Combine the olives with the capers.
67d9fbbc-d40a-4dd9-a0fa-fd5d0bd1f9c4 Chop the olives and capers as finely as you can by hand, or place them in a food processor and pulse several times until the mixture is almost a paste. If using a processor, be careful not to overdo the blending as you want the tapenade to retain some texture.
67d9fbbc-d40a-4dd9-a0fa-fd5d0bd1f9c4 Mix the chopped olives with the remaining ingredients by hand, or in the food processor (again by pulsing several times, just until combined).
67d9fbbc-d40a-4dd9-a0fa-fd5d0bd1f9c4 Taste and adjust harissa, garlic, and lemon juice as desired.
67d9fbbc-d40a-4dd9-a0fa-fd5d0bd1f9c4 For a thinner tapenade, increase the amount of olive oil, stirring in an additional teaspoon or two at a time, until you achieve the desired consistency.
50d51fa2-fa38-4bbc-89c5-e5da51b7c577 Place the artichoke bottoms in a small pot.
50d51fa2-fa38-4bbc-89c5-e5da51b7c577 Add about 2 cups of water (enough to barely cover the artichokes), the olive oil, spices, parsley and preserved lemon.
50d51fa2-fa38-4bbc-89c5-e5da51b7c577 Cover and simmer the artichokes 20 to 30 minutes, until tender.
50d51fa2-fa38-4bbc-89c5-e5da51b7c577 Remove the artichoke bottoms.
50d51fa2-fa38-4bbc-89c5-e5da51b7c577 Cut them into bite-size pieces if serving as a salad, or coarsely chop them if serving as a dip.
50d51fa2-fa38-4bbc-89c5-e5da51b7c577 Return the cut-up artichoke bottoms to the pot with the olives and adjust seasoning to taste.
50d51fa2-fa38-4bbc-89c5-e5da51b7c577 Simmer, uncovered, for a few minutes longer to reduce the liquids to a thick sauce.
50d51fa2-fa38-4bbc-89c5-e5da51b7c577 Serve the salad room temperature or chilled.
1a619f1f-326c-4edc-842b-155224ba554a Gather the ingredients.
1a619f1f-326c-4edc-842b-155224ba554a Melt the butter over low heat in a small saucepan. Increase the heat and bring the melted butter to a simmer. Simmer gently for 30 to 45 minutes, or until the milk solids on the bottom of the pot have turned a light amber.
1a619f1f-326c-4edc-842b-155224ba554a Place a piece of cheesecloth over a bowl and carefully pour the clarified butter (not the solids) through a cheesecloth. Repeat this straining several times if necessary to remove all traces of milk solids. You want only perfectly clear clarified butter for smen.
1a619f1f-326c-4edc-842b-155224ba554a Stir the salt into the strained clarified butter, then pour it into a jar. Cover, and store in a cool, dark place (a cupboard is fine) for a month or longer.
1a619f1f-326c-4edc-842b-155224ba554a After opening, store the smen in the refrigerator.
1a619f1f-326c-4edc-842b-155224ba554a Enjoy!
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Wash and dry the fish.
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Mix all of the Chermoula ingredients, adding a little more lemon juice or vegetable oil if necessary to thin the marinade.
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Taste and adjust the seasoning so that the chermoula is as salty, lemony, and spicy as you like.
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Reserve a little more than half of the chermoula, and use the remaining chermoula to marinate the fish, rubbing the chermoula over the outside of the fish and inside the cavity.
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Cover the fish and leave to marinate while proceeding with the recipe. (Or, refrigerate the fish and leave to marinate at least several hours or even overnight.) Bring the fish to room temperature while proceeding with the recipe.
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Preheat an oven to 425 F (220 C).
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Lightly oil a baking dish with olive oil.
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Distribute the carrots over the bottom of the dish, crossing them to create a bed for the potatoes and fish.
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Add the potato slices in a single layer and season them to taste with salt, ginger, and pepper.
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Place the fish in the baking dish and arrange the tomato slices on and around the fish.
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Thin the reserved chermoula with 1/4 cup of water and several tablespoons of olive oil, and spoon the mixture over the fish and vegetables.
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Top the fish with the green pepper, lemon slices, chili peppers and olives.
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Cover the fish with aluminum foil and bake for 25 minutes.
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Remove the foil and continue baking for another 20 to 30 minutes, until the fish and vegetables are tender.
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 If the liquids in the dish have not reduced to a thick sauce during the baking, you'll want to do this on the stove. Carefully pour out the liquids into a saucepan and cover the fish to keep warm.
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Reduce the liquids to a thick sauce over medium to medium-high heat and pour immediately back into the baking dish.
76546fa8-c817-4f85-a15a-4f6489e916f3 Garnish with the chopped parsley and serve.
1c3612a2-0bf4-4a6a-8208-620c2a443104 Gather the ingredients.
1c3612a2-0bf4-4a6a-8208-620c2a443104 Mix all ingredients in a bowl.
1c3612a2-0bf4-4a6a-8208-620c2a443104 The chermoula is now ready for marinating meats and veggies, dressing potatoes before baking, or mixing into rice, quinoa, or couscous.
1c3612a2-0bf4-4a6a-8208-620c2a443104 Enjoy!
fe92be67-f7f3-452f-b67f-24f92b71bb3b Pour the olive oil into the base of a tagine or the bottom of a wide pot or Dutch oven. Distribute the sliced onion over the bottom.
fe92be67-f7f3-452f-b67f-24f92b71bb3b In a bowl, toss the chicken with the chopped onion, garlic, ground nigella, whole nigella and spices. Arrange the chicken bone side down in the center of the tagine or pot, and distribute the chopped onions all around.
fe92be67-f7f3-452f-b67f-24f92b71bb3b Swirl 1/3 cup of water in the bowl to clean it of the spices, then add the water to the tagine or pot. If using smen, add it to the liquids.
fe92be67-f7f3-452f-b67f-24f92b71bb3b Garnish the tagine with the cilantro bouquet, lemon and olives. Follow one of the cooking methods below.
1f722bc1-6614-4b2d-a494-161cffe05a16 In a mixing bowl, blend together the fine semolina, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Add the butter, and blend with your hands or a wooden spoon just until the mixture is the consistency of sand and the semolina grains have all been moistened.
1f722bc1-6614-4b2d-a494-161cffe05a16 Add 1/2 cup milk and mix until dough forms. It should be quite moist, wet almost, and easily packed into a large mound. Add additional milk if necessary to achieve this consistency.
1f722bc1-6614-4b2d-a494-161cffe05a16 Shape the dough into balls any size that you like and leave the dough to rest a few minutes.
1f722bc1-6614-4b2d-a494-161cffe05a16 Preheat a griddle or frying pan over medium-low heat. While the griddle is heating, roll the balls in the coarse semolina (if using) and flatten each ball into a disc about 1/4-inch thick, or a bit thicker if you like.
1f722bc1-6614-4b2d-a494-161cffe05a16 Cook the harcha over fairly low heat, about 5 to 10 minutes on each side, until they turn a pale to medium golden color. Flip only once, and check occasionally to be sure the harcha aren't coloring too quickly, as they need some time to cook all the way through.
1f722bc1-6614-4b2d-a494-161cffe05a16 Serve immediately with jam, cheese, or butter.
c0feef3f-2a63-46b4-b628-32051985ff2e Gather the ingredients.
c0feef3f-2a63-46b4-b628-32051985ff2e Rinse the beetroots. Place in a pot or pressure cooker and cover with cold water. Boil or pressure cook the beets until tender. Test by piercing the beet with a sharp knife; if it can be inserted into the center, the beet is cooked. This can take up to an hour and a half when boiling, and up to 40 minutes when pressure cooking—how long depends on how large the beets are. If the beets you're cooking are different sizes, simply check the cooking at intervals and remove the beets one by one as they're done, drain the beets, rinse under cold running water and slide the skins off while the beets are still warm.
c0feef3f-2a63-46b4-b628-32051985ff2e Allow the beets to cool.
c0feef3f-2a63-46b4-b628-32051985ff2e Cut the beets into 1/4-inch to 1/2-inch slices of uniform thickness, and then cut each slice into uniformly sized cubes.
c0feef3f-2a63-46b4-b628-32051985ff2e Transfer the cubed beets to a large bowl and combine with the remaining ingredients, seasoning to taste with salt and pepper. Cover tightly and refrigerate at least an hour or overnight.
c0feef3f-2a63-46b4-b628-32051985ff2e Prior to serving, taste the salad and adjust the seasoning if desired. The salad may be garnished with freshly slivered onion or a little more parsley.
cd8fbb97-16c0-4bab-b2f8-1c5087a87f25 Wash the mallow very well several times in a large bowl of water. Drain thoroughly. Finely chop the leaves, place them in a steamer, and steam over simmering water for 15 to 20 minutes, until the leaves darken and are tender.
cd8fbb97-16c0-4bab-b2f8-1c5087a87f25 Squeeze out any excess liquid from the steamed mallow, and transfer the mallow to a skillet. Add the remaining ingredients (except for the olives), stir to mix, and saute over medium heat for 5 to 10 minutes until the parsley is wilted and the flavors have blended. Adjust seasoning if desired.
cd8fbb97-16c0-4bab-b2f8-1c5087a87f25 Serve warm or at room temperature, garnishing the salad with the olives and preserved lemon rinds.
40dd2252-fe74-4c2b-9530-66434264d60a Gather the ingredients.
40dd2252-fe74-4c2b-9530-66434264d60a Peel the carrots and grate them into very fine strands (my preference) or to a pulp.
40dd2252-fe74-4c2b-9530-66434264d60a Peel the oranges and remove as much of the pith as possible by scraping the orange with a knife Separate the oranges into slices, then cut the slices into 1/2-inch pieces.
40dd2252-fe74-4c2b-9530-66434264d60a Mix the carrots and oranges with the remaining ingredients in a bowl. Taste and adjust sugar, lemon juice, and orange flower water as desired.
40dd2252-fe74-4c2b-9530-66434264d60a Cover the salad and refrigerate for a 1/2 hour or more to allow the salad to macerate.
40dd2252-fe74-4c2b-9530-66434264d60a Check on the salad before serving. If it's too dry for your liking, mix in a little additional orange juice.
40dd2252-fe74-4c2b-9530-66434264d60a Spoon the salad and juice into individual serving bowls and serve.
4c5b3dd8-a738-474e-9510-06ac7c241f7a Gather the ingredients.
4c5b3dd8-a738-474e-9510-06ac7c241f7a Trim or snap off the ends from the green beans, removing any stringy fibers which may run the length of the bean. Not all beans will have this fiber. If the beans are excessively long, they can be cut or broken in half for easier eating.
4c5b3dd8-a738-474e-9510-06ac7c241f7a Wash and drain the beans.
4c5b3dd8-a738-474e-9510-06ac7c241f7a Boil or steam the beans just until crisp-tender, about 5 to 7 minutes.
4c5b3dd8-a738-474e-9510-06ac7c241f7a If boiling, drain and submerge the beans in an ice-water bath for a minute or two, and drain again.
4c5b3dd8-a738-474e-9510-06ac7c241f7a Melt the butter or heat the olive oil in a sauté pan or skillet over medium-low heat. Add the garlic and sauté just for 1 minute until fragrant; do not burn.
4c5b3dd8-a738-474e-9510-06ac7c241f7a Add the green beans to the pan and season to taste with salt, black pepper, cumin, and cayenne pepper. Toss gently and cook just until the beans are heated through.
4c5b3dd8-a738-474e-9510-06ac7c241f7a If using parsley, gently stir it in and sprinkle over the top as a garnish.
4c5b3dd8-a738-474e-9510-06ac7c241f7a Serve immediately.
d356c475-817e-4362-aae1-6d227075c369 Activate the yeast by combining it with 1/4 cup of the warm water and a teaspoon of the sugar. Set the mixture aside until it's frothy, about 5 to 10 minutes.
d356c475-817e-4362-aae1-6d227075c369 In a large bowl, combine the flours, remaining sugar, and salt in a mixing bowl. Add the yeast mixture, the oil, and the rest of the water, and mix to form a soft, manageable dough.
d356c475-817e-4362-aae1-6d227075c369 Knead the dough in a mixer with a dough hook, or by hand on a lightly floured surface, for about 10 minutes or until smooth and elastic. The dough should be quite soft but not sticky. If it's too sticky to work with, add a little flour one tablespoon at a time. If the dough feels a bit stiff, work in additional water one tablespoon at a time.
d356c475-817e-4362-aae1-6d227075c369 Divide the dough into smooth balls the size of small plums and let them rest, covered, on a lightly floured surface for about 10 minutes.
d356c475-817e-4362-aae1-6d227075c369 Roll out each ball into a thin circle about 1/8 inch thick. Set the rounds of dough on a clean, dry towel and cover. Leave to rise for about 1 to 1 1/2 hours, until light and puffy.
d356c475-817e-4362-aae1-6d227075c369 Heat a very lightly oiled cast-iron skillet, griddle or other nonstick pan over medium heat. Allow the pan to get quite hot.
d356c475-817e-4362-aae1-6d227075c369 Cook the batbout in batches, turning several times, until golden brown on both sides. The browning will be a bit uneven since the bread puffs up as it cooks, but that's okay.
d356c475-817e-4362-aae1-6d227075c369 Transfer the cooked batbout to a rack or towel-lined basket to cool. It's fine to stack them while they're warm.
d356c475-817e-4362-aae1-6d227075c369 Batbout will keep fresh for two days at room temperature. They freeze well and can be heated directly from the freezer in a microwave oven just until thawed. Avoid overheating or they will dry out.
093afb76-b94f-4ffa-8b15-2a11ec5b4cea Prepare two baking sheets either by oiling the centers or by dusting the pans with coarse semolina.
093afb76-b94f-4ffa-8b15-2a11ec5b4cea In a large bowl combine the fine semolina or durum flour, white flour, sugar, and salt in a bowl. Make a large well in the center of the flour mixture, and add the yeast.
093afb76-b94f-4ffa-8b15-2a11ec5b4cea Add the oil and 1 1/2 cups warm water to the well, mixing to dissolve the yeast first, and then stirring the entire contents of the bowl to incorporate the water into the flour.
093afb76-b94f-4ffa-8b15-2a11ec5b4cea Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and begin kneading the dough. If necessary, add flour or water in very small amounts to make the dough soft and pliable, but not sticky. Continue kneading for 5 to 10 minutes, or until the dough is very smooth and elastic.
093afb76-b94f-4ffa-8b15-2a11ec5b4cea Divide the dough in half and shape each portion into a smooth circular mound. Roll the mounds in some coarse or fine semolina, pressing the grains gently into the surface of the dough.
093afb76-b94f-4ffa-8b15-2a11ec5b4cea Place the dough on the prepared pans and cover with a towel. Allow the dough to rest for 10 minutes.
093afb76-b94f-4ffa-8b15-2a11ec5b4cea After the dough has rested, use the palm of your hand to flatten the dough into large, flat rounds about 1/4" thick. Cover the loaves with a towel, and leave to rise about one hour or longer, until the dough springs back when pressed lightly with a finger.
093afb76-b94f-4ffa-8b15-2a11ec5b4cea Preheat an oven to 435 F/225 C.
093afb76-b94f-4ffa-8b15-2a11ec5b4cea Poke the dough with a fork in several places to create steam vents. Bake the bread for about 20 minutes – rotate the pans about halfway through the baking time – or until the loaves are nicely colored and sound hollow when tapped. Transfer the bread to a rack or towel-lined basket to cool.
093afb76-b94f-4ffa-8b15-2a11ec5b4cea Moroccan bread will keep only a day at room temperature, so plan to freeze leftovers. Thaw at room temperature, then reheat in the oven for just-baked freshness.
a4426cd3-7cd5-4f05-8bfd-6b200ba2f460 Preheat your oven to 400 F / 200 C.
a4426cd3-7cd5-4f05-8bfd-6b200ba2f460 Peel, core and thinly slice the apples.
a4426cd3-7cd5-4f05-8bfd-6b200ba2f460 In a 10-inch skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the sugar and cinnamon and stir to distribute evenly.
a4426cd3-7cd5-4f05-8bfd-6b200ba2f460 Add the sliced apples, cover, and cook for about 5 minutes, or until the apples are tender and a rich syrup has formed. Stir gently once or twice during cooking.
a4426cd3-7cd5-4f05-8bfd-6b200ba2f460 Remove the pan from the heat. Push the apples to distribute them evenly over the bottom of the pan. If you like, you can take the time to arrange them in a pattern.
a4426cd3-7cd5-4f05-8bfd-6b200ba2f460 In a medium-sized bowl, combine the flour with the sugar, baking powder, and salt. Add the egg yolks and milk, whisking until smooth.
a4426cd3-7cd5-4f05-8bfd-6b200ba2f460 With an electric mixer, beat the egg whites to soft peaks. Gently fold the egg whites into the flour mixture, then spread the pancake batter over the cooked apples. Place the pan in the preheated oven and bake for 10 to 15 minutes, or until golden and puffy.
a4426cd3-7cd5-4f05-8bfd-6b200ba2f460 Remove the pan from the oven and use a rubber spatula to loosen the pancake from the sides of the pan. Invert a serving plate over the frying pan then carefully hold the pan and plate together and flip them over so that the cake releases onto the plate.
a4426cd3-7cd5-4f05-8bfd-6b200ba2f460 Serve warm or at room temperature. For best texture, the pancake is best eaten the same day.
3f242064-4eb3-41a6-9419-172f37cdf7ac Gather the ingredients.
3f242064-4eb3-41a6-9419-172f37cdf7ac Peel the avocado and cut in half. Discard the pit.
3f242064-4eb3-41a6-9419-172f37cdf7ac Put the avocado and the sugar in a blender with 1 cup of milk. Blend until very creamy and smooth.
3f242064-4eb3-41a6-9419-172f37cdf7ac Gradually add another cup or two of milk to make the shake as thin or as thick as you like. How much milk you need will depend on the size and ripeness of the avocado.
3f242064-4eb3-41a6-9419-172f37cdf7ac Add a handful of ice to the blender if you like your shake well-chilled, and blend for another minute. Taste and adjust sugar if necessary.
3f242064-4eb3-41a6-9419-172f37cdf7ac Pour into glasses and serve.
ff151dfc-a2ca-4eac-8281-4f87e8ea9a6f By hand or with a mixer, beat the eggs, sugar, and oil until thick. Beat in the vanilla (or zest) and salt, and stir in the cornflour until smooth. Mix in enough flour to form a somewhat stiff but pliable dough.
ff151dfc-a2ca-4eac-8281-4f87e8ea9a6f Line two large baking trays with parchment paper. Feed the dough through a large fluted tip attached to a manual meat grinder, pastry bag or cookie press. Use scissors to cut the dough into 2-inch strips (I like to gently twist the dough) and arrange the sticks fairly close together on the lined trays.
ff151dfc-a2ca-4eac-8281-4f87e8ea9a6f Preheat your oven to 350 F (180 C). Bake the cookies, one pan at a time, for about 15 minutes, or until lightly colored. Carefully transfer the parchment paper with cookies to a rack to cool.
f51cb0d5-aa01-4b05-9d12-948e3db19673 Preheat your oven to 350 F (180 C). Grease and flour a Bundt or small tube pan.
f51cb0d5-aa01-4b05-9d12-948e3db19673 If desired, separate the eggs. In a large bowl, beat the egg whites with an electric mixer until stiff. Set aside. (This step is optional; you can add whole eggs in the next step if you prefer.)
f51cb0d5-aa01-4b05-9d12-948e3db19673 In another large bowl, beat together by hand or with a mixer the yogurt (reserve the empty container to use as your measure), the vegetable oil, sugar and egg yolks (or whole eggs, if you chose not to separate the eggs).
f51cb0d5-aa01-4b05-9d12-948e3db19673 Stir in the vanilla, flour, baking powder and salt; beat briskly by hand or with an electric mixer until smooth.
f51cb0d5-aa01-4b05-9d12-948e3db19673 If you separated the eggs, gently fold the beaten egg whites into the cake batter, being careful to incorporate all of the whites evenly.
f51cb0d5-aa01-4b05-9d12-948e3db19673 Pour the batter into the prepared cake and bake for 40 to 45 minutes, or until the cake tests done.
f51cb0d5-aa01-4b05-9d12-948e3db19673 Allow the cake to cool in the pan for five to 10 minutes before inverting onto a plate. The cake may be served warm, but it will improve in flavor and texture as it sits. Allow it to cool completely before storing in an airtight container.
1145338b-7cfe-4c6f-8bc7-a593ff786019 Gather the ingredients.
1145338b-7cfe-4c6f-8bc7-a593ff786019 Line a large baking sheet or pan with aluminum foil or parchment paper. Set aside.
1145338b-7cfe-4c6f-8bc7-a593ff786019 In a heavy-bottomed skillet, combine the peanuts, sugar, and water. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly until the mixture thickens into a syrup.
1145338b-7cfe-4c6f-8bc7-a593ff786019 Continue cooking and stirring for about 10 minutes, or until the liquids evaporate and a sandy-textured sugar mixture coats the peanuts.
1145338b-7cfe-4c6f-8bc7-a593ff786019 Lower the heat a bit and continue stirring as the excess sugar in the pan begins to melt. This will take several minutes. Once the syrup begins to form, it will change in color from clear to golden to amber. Stir constantly, and be careful that the heat is not so high as to burn or darken the syrup too much.
1145338b-7cfe-4c6f-8bc7-a593ff786019 When the syrup is a light-to-medium-amber color and the sugary coating on the peanuts has glazed, remove the skillet from the heat.
1145338b-7cfe-4c6f-8bc7-a593ff786019 Sprinkle the salt and orange flower water (if using) over the peanuts and stir.
1145338b-7cfe-4c6f-8bc7-a593ff786019 Turn the peanuts out onto your prepared pan and quickly spread them in a single layer. Allow them to cool and harden before serving.
1145338b-7cfe-4c6f-8bc7-a593ff786019 Be sure the caramelized peanuts have cooled completely before storing in an airtight container.
1145338b-7cfe-4c6f-8bc7-a593ff786019 Enjoy!
cd36cde4-79a7-4dfa-8417-64ab394bfe4d Gather the ingredients.
cd36cde4-79a7-4dfa-8417-64ab394bfe4d Preheat an oven to 350 F / 180 C.
cd36cde4-79a7-4dfa-8417-64ab394bfe4d Sift together the flour, salt, and cinnamon and set aside. In another bowl, with an electric mixer, beat the butter and sugar until creamy. Beat in the egg yolks and vanilla.
cd36cde4-79a7-4dfa-8417-64ab394bfe4d Gradually mix in the flour mixture to form a thick, stiff dough. (Note: An electric mixer with a paddle attachment will help pull together the dough, which may initially be crumbly. Or, use your hands to warm the ingredients and work the dough, squeezing and kneading, to help combine the ingredients into a manageable dough.) If using the ground nuts, mix them in as well.
cd36cde4-79a7-4dfa-8417-64ab394bfe4d Shape the dough into small balls about 1" (3 cm) in diameter. Place the balls on ungreased baking sheets (you can line the pans with parchment paper if you like) and flatten them by pressing with a fork in a criss-cross pattern. Brush the tops lightly with egg white (not too much).
cd36cde4-79a7-4dfa-8417-64ab394bfe4d Bake the cookies 8 to 9 minutes, or until barely colored for a chewy cookie; bake for 10 to 12 minutes, or until golden for a crispy cookie.
cd36cde4-79a7-4dfa-8417-64ab394bfe4d Allow the cookies to cool on the baking sheet for a minute before transferring them to a rack to cool completely.
7027cd2e-62bb-4f1f-a0c8-95717514d725 First, prepare the tarator dipping sauce by combing the yogurt, bread crumbs, crushed walnuts, garlic, lemon juice and salt in a chopper or food processor. Set the sauce aside to set.
7027cd2e-62bb-4f1f-a0c8-95717514d725 Next, prepare the mussels. Make sure the mussels have no remaining pieces of beard or debris. Rinse them under very cold water and pat them dry with paper towels.
7027cd2e-62bb-4f1f-a0c8-95717514d725 Dip each mussel in flour and shake off the excess.
7027cd2e-62bb-4f1f-a0c8-95717514d725 Put three floured mussels on each bamboo skewer leaving space at one end for holding.
7027cd2e-62bb-4f1f-a0c8-95717514d725 In a deep skillet or saucepan add the oil and heat it for frying.
7027cd2e-62bb-4f1f-a0c8-95717514d725 While the oil heats up, whisk together the club soda, flour, salt and egg yolk until smooth in a large mixing bowl.
7027cd2e-62bb-4f1f-a0c8-95717514d725 When it thickens to resemble the consistency of cake batter, stop whisking and set it aside.
7027cd2e-62bb-4f1f-a0c8-95717514d725 In a separate bowl, stir together the water and baking soda until well combined. Set it aside.
7027cd2e-62bb-4f1f-a0c8-95717514d725 Dip the mussels on each skewer in the batter and turn it until all the mussels are well covered.
7027cd2e-62bb-4f1f-a0c8-95717514d725 After the batter, immediately dip the mussels in the baking soda and water mixture and put it in the hot oil to fry.
7027cd2e-62bb-4f1f-a0c8-95717514d725 Turn the mussels on the skewer as they cook with thongs so they brown evenly on all sides.
7027cd2e-62bb-4f1f-a0c8-95717514d725 Put a few hot skewers on a plate with a dolop of tarator sauce for dipping. You can also spread some tarator sauce between the crusts of a hunk of Turkish bread.
7027cd2e-62bb-4f1f-a0c8-95717514d725 Then use the bread to hold the mussels and slide them off the skewer.
8f95f2e4-8597-4d53-9076-b44c89b1a79e Drain the chickpeas and rinse them under cold water in a wire strainer until the water runs clear. Put the olive oil in a pan and saute the crushed garlic on low heat until tender, but not browned.
8f95f2e4-8597-4d53-9076-b44c89b1a79e Add the drained chickpeas and enough water to just cover them. Bring to a boil, reduce the heat and cover, leaving the lid on a crack. Let the chickpeas simmer gently until the water disappears, usually 10 to 15 minutes.
8f95f2e4-8597-4d53-9076-b44c89b1a79e When the chickpeas are falling apart, transfer them, together with any remaining liquid, to a food processor. Add the lemon juice, lemon zest, tahini and spices and process them on high until you have a very smooth paste.
8f95f2e4-8597-4d53-9076-b44c89b1a79e Stop a few times during processing to scrape the sides and add some water. Continue processing and adding water until you have the consistency you want. Some people prefer thick hummus while other prefer it softer. You decide.
8f95f2e4-8597-4d53-9076-b44c89b1a79e Empty the hummus into a clay or other oven-proof baking dish. Cover the top lightly with aluminum foil. Bake it in a 350°F oven until it's warmed well through. While the hummus is baking, fry your pastırma or other meat in a small skillet until crispy. Remove the hummus from the oven and sprinkle the top with the crumbled meat and drizzle it with some olive oil.
8f95f2e4-8597-4d53-9076-b44c89b1a79e You can serve your warm hummus the Turkish way, along with other appetizers, or with slivers of pita bread or crackers as a spread or dip. If you plan to serve the hummus later that day, cover it immediately to prevent the top and edges from drying and darkening. If you refrigerate your hummus, keep it air tight and make sure to give it time to warm up to room temperature again before serving.
d1e9e6cf-e435-4f5b-9315-7cb55f2dbcfb If you’re using round ‘yufka’ sheets, use a pizza cutter or sharp knife to cut them into triangles. Divide each circle into eight to ten triangular slices like you are slicing a pizza. The wide base of each triangle should be about four to five inches wide.
d1e9e6cf-e435-4f5b-9315-7cb55f2dbcfb If you are using frozen phyllo, thaw it gently according to the package directions. Here are some tips on working with frozen phyllo.
d1e9e6cf-e435-4f5b-9315-7cb55f2dbcfb Using two phyllo sheets, one on top of the other, begin at the center point of one of the short edges. Cut diagonally down to the left bottom corner. Starting again from the top center point, cut diagonally down to the right bottom corner. This will give you three pastry triangles from each rectangular sheet.
d1e9e6cf-e435-4f5b-9315-7cb55f2dbcfb In a small bowl, crumble the white cheese or feta with your fingers. Add the chopped parsley and salt and pepper to taste.
d1e9e6cf-e435-4f5b-9315-7cb55f2dbcfb Take a pastry triangle and position it so the wide end is at the bottom and the point is pointing away from you. Spread about a tablespoon of the filling in a thin line near the bottom edge, leaving about one-half inch empty on each side.
d1e9e6cf-e435-4f5b-9315-7cb55f2dbcfb Before you begin rolling, fold the bottom right and left corners of the pastry toward the center to cover the edges of the filling. This will trap the filling inside as you roll the pastry up.
d1e9e6cf-e435-4f5b-9315-7cb55f2dbcfb Using your fingers, gently roll the pastry away from you toward the point of the triangle. Try to tuck in any open edges as you go along. When you get to the end, wet the inside of the point of the triangle and stick it to the roll. This will seal it keep it closed as it fries.
d1e9e6cf-e435-4f5b-9315-7cb55f2dbcfb Heat about two inches of oil to frying temperature. Add several pastries to the pan leaving some space in between them to prevent them from sticking to each other.
d1e9e6cf-e435-4f5b-9315-7cb55f2dbcfb Using prongs or a fork, move them around as they fry for a more even color. When the ends begin to brown, flip them over and let the other side cook. When the pastries are done, they should be golden brown all over with darker ends.
d1e9e6cf-e435-4f5b-9315-7cb55f2dbcfb Drain the pastries on a thick layer of paper towels before serving.
df3a654a-2a7a-40cc-87f3-76be65fe1c7b In a large bowl, melt the butter in the microwave. Next, stir in the milk, salt, and pepper. Microwave again on high until the milk is warm but not scalding.
df3a654a-2a7a-40cc-87f3-76be65fe1c7b In a separate bowl, toss together the crumbled white cheese and chopped parsley.
df3a654a-2a7a-40cc-87f3-76be65fe1c7b Butter the bottom and sides of a large, oven-proof baking tray. Drizzle a spoonful or two of the milk mixture over the bottom. Next, take the first sheet of yufka and place it in an uneven, wrinkly fashion to cover the bottom of the tray. Spoon about 1/6 of the milk mixture all over the yufka. Let it run into the cracks and crevices and around the edges.
df3a654a-2a7a-40cc-87f3-76be65fe1c7b Divide the cheese mixture roughly into five parts. Sprinkle 1/5 of the cheese mixture over the yufka. Now, do the same with the next layer. Repeat until you have five layers finished. Cover the top of your pastry completely with the last piece of yufka. Drizzle the last portion of the milk mixture over the top, wetting all of it.
df3a654a-2a7a-40cc-87f3-76be65fe1c7b Sprinkle the top of your pastry with sesame seeds or nigella seeds. Bake it in a 185 F/365 C oven for about 45 minutes, or until the top is nicely browned and the center is firm.
df3a654a-2a7a-40cc-87f3-76be65fe1c7b When your pastry is cooked, remove the pan from oven and sprinkle one or two tablespoons of cold water over the top, then wrap the whole thing in clean butcher's paper or a clean towel. This helps to soften the top layer. Let the pastry rest for about 20 minutes before cutting it into squares.
4f1bfb32-edae-4e92-bff3-c5246431016c Gather the ingredients.
4f1bfb32-edae-4e92-bff3-c5246431016c Bring the water to a rolling boil in a covered saucepan. Add the dry fava beans, reduce the heat and cover. Let the mixture simmer slowly until the fava beans are very soft and falling apart, and the water is reduced, about 20 minutes.
4f1bfb32-edae-4e92-bff3-c5246431016c Once the beans are soft enough to fall apart when you touch them with a wooden spoon, add the salt, pepper, sugar, and olive oil to the pan and stir until combined.
4f1bfb32-edae-4e92-bff3-c5246431016c Place a large, fine wire strainer over another pan or large bowl. Pour some of the pasty bean mixture into the strainer and press it through using a wooden spoon. Repeat until you've pressed through all the mixture. Don't forget to remove the extra from the bottom of the strainer.
4f1bfb32-edae-4e92-bff3-c5246431016c You should have a thick, pasty but smooth mixture with no lumps. If your paste seems too thick and dry, stir in about 1 tablespoon more olive oil.
4f1bfb32-edae-4e92-bff3-c5246431016c While the paste is still warm, spoon it into a shallow rectangular, square, or circle-shaped serving dish about 3 inches deep. Glass works best. We like to use a 9-inch round glass oven dish. Smooth the top of the paste with the bottom of a spoon. Set it aside to cool and set.
4f1bfb32-edae-4e92-bff3-c5246431016c Once it's cooled down to room temperature, cover it with plastic wrap and refrigerate it for several hours.
4f1bfb32-edae-4e92-bff3-c5246431016c When you remove it from the refrigerator, the paste should have set and be firm enough to cut. Wet the blade of a sharp knife and cut the fava into squares or diamonds. Make sure to re-wet the blade often to prevent sticking.
4f1bfb32-edae-4e92-bff3-c5246431016c Remove the blocks of fava gently and arrange them on your serving plate. Drizzle them with a little extra-virgin olive oil and sprinkle the chopped, fresh dill weed over the top.
e4418081-3fff-4b48-884e-014197e3ab2c Handle your squash flowers very gently to avoid bruising or tearing. Do not wash them as this will cause the delicate petals to stick together.
e4418081-3fff-4b48-884e-014197e3ab2c Prepare your flowers for stuffing by gently removing any green leaves at the base. Set them aside.
e4418081-3fff-4b48-884e-014197e3ab2c Now it's time to prepare the stuffing. First, put a shallow pan on a medium flame and fry the onions in the olive oil until they are soft and reduced.
e4418081-3fff-4b48-884e-014197e3ab2c Add the pine nuts and brown them.
e4418081-3fff-4b48-884e-014197e3ab2c Add all the other dry ingredients and mix well.
e4418081-3fff-4b48-884e-014197e3ab2c Stir in the water, then bring to a boil. Cover and simmer over low heat until the water is almost absorbed. You'll know it's ready when you have a fragrant mixture of half-cooked rice.
e4418081-3fff-4b48-884e-014197e3ab2c Once your filling cools down enough to handle, you can begin stuffing your flowers. Handling each flower gently, fill the center of each using a small spoon and fold the petal tips over the top of the stuffing, so they overlap, covering the filling completely.
e4418081-3fff-4b48-884e-014197e3ab2c Do your best not to overstuff the flowers. You need to leave enough room for the rice to expand while they cook. Don't worry, it takes some practice to get it just right, but once your fingers get used to it, stuffing is easy!
e4418081-3fff-4b48-884e-014197e3ab2c As you stuff each flower, place them side by sidelining the bottom of another shallow pan. You can start a second layer if necessary, but keeping them to a single layer is always best.
e4418081-3fff-4b48-884e-014197e3ab2c Add enough water to the pan to cover the stuffed flowers, but no more. Drizzle about 2 tablespoons of extra-virgin olive over the mixture and add some extra salt to the water.
e4418081-3fff-4b48-884e-014197e3ab2c Bring the pan to a soft boil, then immediately reduce the heat to low and cover. The flowers should simmer very gently with the cover on until all the water is absorbed.
e4418081-3fff-4b48-884e-014197e3ab2c Remove the pan from the heat and let it continue to steam until it cools to room temperature. If too much condensation forms on the lid, cover the pan with paper towels and close the lid over them letting the flowers continue to steam.
e4418081-3fff-4b48-884e-014197e3ab2c When the flowers have cooled down, they will become firmer and easier to remove from the pan. Remove each one gently with your fingers being careful not to damage it, or the other flowers around it.
e4418081-3fff-4b48-884e-014197e3ab2c Place each 'dolma' on a decorative serving dish creating a random pile, drizzle them with some more olive oil and garnish the plate with a few fresh zucchini flowers, if desired.
27c66343-3599-4070-888a-38313234a02c First cut off any roots from the purslane. Wash and drain it twice to make sure there is no soil or grit left on the leaves.
27c66343-3599-4070-888a-38313234a02c Separate the leaves from the stems. You can save the stems for use in other recipes if you wish. Spin the leaves in a salad spinner to remove any extra moisture.
27c66343-3599-4070-888a-38313234a02c In a separate bowl, whip together the other ingredients using a wire whisk until smooth and creamy. Adjust the amount of salt and pepper to your taste.
27c66343-3599-4070-888a-38313234a02c Add the purslane leaves and mix together well. Make sure all the leaves are covered with the yogurt mixture.
27c66343-3599-4070-888a-38313234a02c Serve immediately, or cover and chill it for several hours or overnight. The flavor actually gets better if the salad rests for a while. Gently stir it again before serving.
c0509514-e32d-4e78-aa2e-4b377a87d7be Gather the ingredients.
c0509514-e32d-4e78-aa2e-4b377a87d7be In a mixing bowl, stir together the feta cheese, egg, and parsley.
c0509514-e32d-4e78-aa2e-4b377a87d7be Add the oil to a large pot or deep skillet and heat it to 350 F.
c0509514-e32d-4e78-aa2e-4b377a87d7be While the oil is heating, remove the phyllo dough from the refrigerator. (Be sure to have a damp towel on hand to cover the phyllo you are not working with. Phyllo dough dries out quickly if left uncovered.)
c0509514-e32d-4e78-aa2e-4b377a87d7be Take one sheet of phyllo and cut it into fourths. Each piece should be about 4 x 8 inches.
c0509514-e32d-4e78-aa2e-4b377a87d7be Brush each piece with the melted butter. Place about 1 tablespoon of cheese mixture at the base of the dough strip and roll up. Seal by adding a little melted butter.
c0509514-e32d-4e78-aa2e-4b377a87d7be Repeat with the remaining phyllo, butter and cheese mixture.
c0509514-e32d-4e78-aa2e-4b377a87d7be Fry in about 2 inches of oil for 2-4 minutes, or until golden brown.
c0509514-e32d-4e78-aa2e-4b377a87d7be Use a sieve to remove from the oil and drain on a paper towel.
c0509514-e32d-4e78-aa2e-4b377a87d7be Serve immediately and enjoy!
2cef5f09-3a4c-43af-bcf2-651aa6826b6c Gather the ingredients.
2cef5f09-3a4c-43af-bcf2-651aa6826b6c Place chicken in a large, covered saucepan. Fill the pan with water to just cover the chicken. Add the salt, pepper, peeled onion, and carrot whole. Bring to a boil, cover and reduce the heat. Let the chicken simmer slowly until the meat is falling off the bones.
2cef5f09-3a4c-43af-bcf2-651aa6826b6c While your chicken is cooking, you can crush your walnuts. The traditional way is to crush them between two layers of wax paper using a rolling pin. This allows the natural oil from the walnuts to blend with the mixture for the best flavor and consistency. If you're in a hurry, you can process the walnuts in a food processor to make a fine powder.
2cef5f09-3a4c-43af-bcf2-651aa6826b6c Once the chicken is thoroughly cooked, keep the pan covered and let it cool down. When the chicken is cool enough to handle, remove it from the broth and put it on a separate platter. Remove the onion and carrot and discard them.
2cef5f09-3a4c-43af-bcf2-651aa6826b6c Wearing rubber gloves, separate all the meat from the bones, and discard all the bones, skin, and gristle. Then pull the large chunks of meat into small strips.
2cef5f09-3a4c-43af-bcf2-651aa6826b6c While the broth is still warm, strain it through a fine wire strainer into a large bowl. Add your stale bread to the broth in the bowl and break it up with your fingers so there are no large pieces of bread.
2cef5f09-3a4c-43af-bcf2-651aa6826b6c Add the crushed walnuts, crushed garlic and paprika and mix together well. Lastly, add the shredded chicken and mix until combined. Adjust the salt to your taste. Cover and refrigerate for a few hours before serving.
2cef5f09-3a4c-43af-bcf2-651aa6826b6c To prepare your dish for serving, spread the mixture in a shallow serving dish. Decorate the top with walnut halves. Mix one teaspoon of paprika with one tablespoon of olive oil and drizzle the 'red' oil over the top for the final touch.
2cef5f09-3a4c-43af-bcf2-651aa6826b6c Serve and enjoy!
7e193f4d-b7eb-4846-ab1a-1527a5038539 Gather the ingredients.
7e193f4d-b7eb-4846-ab1a-1527a5038539 In a mixing bowl, combine the grated cucumbers and minced garlic. Add salt to taste.
7e193f4d-b7eb-4846-ab1a-1527a5038539 Mix in the yogurt with a wooden spoon, and transfer to a serving bowl. Garnish with the mint or dill, and drizzle olive oil on top. Serve immediately or cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate.
7e193f4d-b7eb-4846-ab1a-1527a5038539 Enjoy!
32fc2592-2337-4c13-92d3-47d417b10525 Gather the ingredients.
32fc2592-2337-4c13-92d3-47d417b10525 Rinse the chicken in cold water. Blot the meat dry on paper towels.
32fc2592-2337-4c13-92d3-47d417b10525 Cut the meat into bite-sized cubes about the size of large dice.
32fc2592-2337-4c13-92d3-47d417b10525 Using the finest grater possible, make a pulp from the onion and garlic cloves.
32fc2592-2337-4c13-92d3-47d417b10525 Pour this pulp and juice into a very fine mesh strainer and, using a wooden spoon, press out the juice into a separate bowl.
32fc2592-2337-4c13-92d3-47d417b10525 Discard the onion and garlic pulp.
32fc2592-2337-4c13-92d3-47d417b10525 In a glass or ceramic bowl, combine the onion-garlic juice, yogurt or milk, oil, tomato paste, black pepper, paprika, and salt.
32fc2592-2337-4c13-92d3-47d417b10525 Add the cubed chicken and toss to coat.
32fc2592-2337-4c13-92d3-47d417b10525 Cover the bowl and refrigerate it for at least 4 hours or overnight for the best results.
32fc2592-2337-4c13-92d3-47d417b10525 If using bamboo skewers, soak them in water for a few hours so they don't ignite on the grill.
32fc2592-2337-4c13-92d3-47d417b10525 Preheat a grill to medium heat.
32fc2592-2337-4c13-92d3-47d417b10525 Remove the pieces from the marinade and thread them onto small metal or bamboo kebab skewers. The chunks of chicken can touch each other, but don’t put them too close together to ensure they cook through. Discard any remaining marinade.
32fc2592-2337-4c13-92d3-47d417b10525 Sprinkle the kebabs with salt and put them on the grill. Grill them evenly on all sides, about 12 minutes total. You can sprinkle Turkish spices like oregano, sumac, and paprika over the hot kebabs to add extra flavor.
32fc2592-2337-4c13-92d3-47d417b10525 Serve and enjoy.
90facbc6-e78b-41a4-97fe-7492fec48e0c Heat the grill to medium.
90facbc6-e78b-41a4-97fe-7492fec48e0c Put all the ingredients in a large mixing bowl. If you are using bread slices, wet them and squeeze out the water before adding them to the bowl.
90facbc6-e78b-41a4-97fe-7492fec48e0c Briskly knead together all the ingredients for several minutes until well-blended. Set aside to rest for a few minutes.
90facbc6-e78b-41a4-97fe-7492fec48e0c Break off an apricot-sized piece of the meat mixture and form the desired shape with your hands. Flattened meatballs or patties cook up the best.
90facbc6-e78b-41a4-97fe-7492fec48e0c Place each patty on the grill. Grill patties, turning once until browned on both sides.
de98f946-d535-4ec6-bc4d-468be42f435f Place the ½ chicken in a pot and fill it with enough water to cover the chicken by one inch. Peel the carrot and the onion and place them in the pot. Bring the water to a boil, then reduce the heat and cover the pot. Let the chicken simmer gently until the meat is falling off the bones, about 30 minutes. Set it aside to cool.
de98f946-d535-4ec6-bc4d-468be42f435f When the chicken is cool enough to handle, discard the onion and carrot. Remove the chicken from the broth and separate all the meat from the bones, Discard the bones, skin, and gristle. Strain the broth through a fine wire strainer and set it aside.
de98f946-d535-4ec6-bc4d-468be42f435f Drain and rinse the chickpeas and set them aside. In a large, shallow pan, melt the butter together with the oil. Add the rice and work the oils through all the grains with a wooden spoon. On low heat, continue to ‘fry’ the dry rice for a few minutes.
de98f946-d535-4ec6-bc4d-468be42f435f Add the chickpeas, chicken broth, water, and spices. Bring the liquid to a boil, then reduce the heat and cover. Let the rice simmer very gently on low heat until all the liquid is absorbed.
de98f946-d535-4ec6-bc4d-468be42f435f Turn off the heat. Open the top of the pan and arrange the chicken pieces over the top of the cooked rice. Do this quickly as you don’t want to lose too much steam. Replace the cover and let the rice continue to steam for about 10 minutes more.
de98f946-d535-4ec6-bc4d-468be42f435f When you are ready to serve it, remove the lid. Using a large bowl as a mold, arrange the chicken pieces in the bottom and up the sides of the bowl. Using the wooden spoon, fill the bowl with the hot rice and gently pack it down to make it firm. When the bowl is full, turn it upside down on your serving plate. You can garnish the top with a sprinkle of chopped fresh herbs if you wish.
de98f946-d535-4ec6-bc4d-468be42f435f Serve the rice piping hot with a glass of ice cold Turkish yogurt drink, called ‘ayran’ (ai-RAHN’).
c8e8474d-5d81-46aa-ac07-b1d503d97845 First, fill a medium saucepan with water. Add about one teaspoon of salt and bring it to a boil. Add the frozen or fresh shrimp. Boil for 1 to 2 minutes only. Drain the shrimp and run them under cold water to keep them from cooking too much.
c8e8474d-5d81-46aa-ac07-b1d503d97845 Peel and dice the onion and garlic cloves. Peel the tomatoes and dice them. Clean the green peppers and dice them about the same size as the tomatoes. Drain or clean the mushrooms.
c8e8474d-5d81-46aa-ac07-b1d503d97845 Heat the olive oil in a saucepan and fry the onions and garlic until they soften and become transparent. Add the green peppers and cook a few minutes more. Add the diced tomato, mushrooms, tomato paste, and spices and let the mixture simmer until most of the liquid is gone.
c8e8474d-5d81-46aa-ac07-b1d503d97845 Add the cooked shrimp and gently turn the mixture with a wooden spoon to evenly distribute the shrimp throughout. Transfer the mixture into one large or several small clay pots or oven-proof dishes. Cover the top(s) generously with grated cheese.
c8e8474d-5d81-46aa-ac07-b1d503d97845 Put the casserole(s) in the oven set on the broil setting on a rack near the top. Cook them until the cheese is bubbly and browns nicely. Remove the casserole and serve it immediately while it's still piping hot. Serve it with crusty bread to dip in the juice.
f82a834d-1e7d-4d0f-a455-2ee551a07d8c Gather the ingredients.
f82a834d-1e7d-4d0f-a455-2ee551a07d8c Wash the tomatoes and peel them using a small, sharp knife. Place the peeled tomatoes in a food processor and puree them, or finely grate them using a hand grater.
f82a834d-1e7d-4d0f-a455-2ee551a07d8c Rinse the bulgur under cold water in a wire strainer for a few minutes. Drain it and put it in a large mixing bowl along with the tomato puree. Mix together well, cover the bowl, and set it aside for about 1 hour until the bulgur is softened.
f82a834d-1e7d-4d0f-a455-2ee551a07d8c Peel and coarsely chop the onions and garlic and put them in the food processor along with the stale bread and the walnut halves. Pulverize on high speed until you have a fine powder.
f82a834d-1e7d-4d0f-a455-2ee551a07d8c Add this mixture to the tomato and bulgur along with the rest of the ingredients. Wearing rubber gloves, knead the mixture until all the ingredients are well combined.
f82a834d-1e7d-4d0f-a455-2ee551a07d8c Divide the mixture into portions small enough to fit inside the food processor. Process each portion on medium speed until smooth. Combine all the processed portions together in a large bowl and continue to knead until it has a smooth consistency.
f82a834d-1e7d-4d0f-a455-2ee551a07d8c Place in a bowl and cover with an airtight seal; set aside for at least 5 hours or overnight.
f82a834d-1e7d-4d0f-a455-2ee551a07d8c The next morning, break off bite-sized pieces of the mixture and shape them into the fingerprint shapes. Arrange them on a serving plate with leaves of Romaine lettuce and slivers of fresh lemon for squeezing.
8bce3ce6-cd60-4187-a064-b61ca250fc80 Gather the ingredients.
8bce3ce6-cd60-4187-a064-b61ca250fc80 First, put the rice in a covered saucepan with 3 cups of water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat, cover, and cook the rice until it softens.
8bce3ce6-cd60-4187-a064-b61ca250fc80 In a separate bowl, beat the egg, plain yogurt, flour, and 1 cup of water briskly with a wire whisk until well blended and creamy. Make sure you have no lumps of flour or yogurt.
8bce3ce6-cd60-4187-a064-b61ca250fc80 Using your wire whisk, stir the rice-water mixture and add the yogurt-water mixture while gently whisking. Then, add salt and white pepper. Allow the mixture to heat through until steaming. Continue whisking gently without letting the soup come to a boil. If the soup becomes too thick for your liking, add a little more water.
8bce3ce6-cd60-4187-a064-b61ca250fc80 In a separate pan, melt the butter and add the dried mint. Stir thoroughly and remove from the heat quickly. Add the butter and mint to the soup and continue whisking until well combined. Garnish each bowl of soup with a sprig of fresh mint leaves.
8bce3ce6-cd60-4187-a064-b61ca250fc80 If you wish, you can also keep the butter and mint separate and drizzle it over the top of the soup just before serving. If you want to spice up your soup a little more, optionally add about 1 teaspoon hot red pepper flakes to the butter along with the mint.
8bce3ce6-cd60-4187-a064-b61ca250fc80 Serve and enjoy!
4ac081f2-646e-4b5f-a4f3-981ecddb2a51 Gather the ingredients.
4ac081f2-646e-4b5f-a4f3-981ecddb2a51 Peel and dice the onion.
4ac081f2-646e-4b5f-a4f3-981ecddb2a51 Peel the tomatoes with a sharp knife and dice them, saving the juice.
4ac081f2-646e-4b5f-a4f3-981ecddb2a51 Remove the seeds from the peppers and dice them as well.
4ac081f2-646e-4b5f-a4f3-981ecddb2a51 Melt the butter in a large skillet. Sauté the onion until tender and translucent.
4ac081f2-646e-4b5f-a4f3-981ecddb2a51 When the onions are cooked, add all the diced vegetables and spices and stir to combine.
4ac081f2-646e-4b5f-a4f3-981ecddb2a51 Bring the mixture to a boil, then cover and reduce the heat. Let the mixture simmer gently until the tomatoes and peppers soften and release their natural juice.
4ac081f2-646e-4b5f-a4f3-981ecddb2a51 Remove the lid and continue to simmer, letting some of the liquid evaporate.
4ac081f2-646e-4b5f-a4f3-981ecddb2a51 Lightly salt and scramble the eggs in a separate bowl.
4ac081f2-646e-4b5f-a4f3-981ecddb2a51 Then pour them in the center of the pan. Don't stir the mixture. Let the eggs travel through the vegetables on their own. You can help them by moving the skillet around.
4ac081f2-646e-4b5f-a4f3-981ecddb2a51 Let the mixture continue to simmer until the eggs are cooked. If the tops of the eggs still seem raw, cover the pan for a few minutes.
4ac081f2-646e-4b5f-a4f3-981ecddb2a51 Your menemen should be fully cooked but still very juicy. You can drizzle some extra melted butter over the top before serving if you wish.
4ac081f2-646e-4b5f-a4f3-981ecddb2a51 Serve and enjoy!
d1e478b5-9405-4b35-a08f-be73680efc55 Squeeze the extra liquid out of the grated onion and place it in a covered saucepan along with the meat and the grated tomatoes. Add the salt, pepper, and sugar. Stir the ingredients until combined.
d1e478b5-9405-4b35-a08f-be73680efc55 Start the mixture on high heat, then reduce the heat to low and cover. Let the meat simmer very slowly, stirring occasionally until it's very tender and the tomato and onion are reduced to a thick sauce, about 1 hour.
d1e478b5-9405-4b35-a08f-be73680efc55 While the meat is cooking, prepare the eggplant mash. If you are using fresh eggplant, roast them and extract the flesh.
d1e478b5-9405-4b35-a08f-be73680efc55 If you are using jarred eggplant, drain the contents in a fine wire strainer and rinse with a little water. Press the eggplant flesh in the strainer to remove the extra liquid.
d1e478b5-9405-4b35-a08f-be73680efc55 Melt the butter in a large shallow saucepan or skillet. Add the flour and stir for a minute or two without allowing the flour to burn. Add the milk and stir with a wire whisk to form a smooth bechamel.
d1e478b5-9405-4b35-a08f-be73680efc55 Add the salt, pepper, and optional garlic and continue stirring with the whisk over low heat. Don't allow the mixture to boil. Add your eggplant and cheese and continue stirring until you have a smooth mixture with no large pieces of eggplant.
d1e478b5-9405-4b35-a08f-be73680efc55 Turn the heat to the lowest possible setting, cover the pan and let it gently bubble for about 5 minutes. When your eggplant mash is ready, give it a final stir. Then cover the bottom of your serving platter generously with the hot mash.
d1e478b5-9405-4b35-a08f-be73680efc55 Arrange the hot beef stew on top of the mash at the center of the platter, leaving a ring of mash all around the meat. Garnish with fresh rosemary sprigs just before serving.
aee0b295-2815-47c5-8488-694392903c37 Cube the liver with a sharp knife. The cubes should be about the size of dice. Place the cubed liver in a colander and rinse under very cold water washing away any extra blood.
aee0b295-2815-47c5-8488-694392903c37 Set aside to drain for a few minutes, then turn the washed liver cubes out on paper towels to remove the extra moisture.
aee0b295-2815-47c5-8488-694392903c37 In a clean plastic bag, shake together the salt, pepper, flour, and paprika. Add liver cubes and shake them inside the bag until all are lightly covered with the flour mixture.
aee0b295-2815-47c5-8488-694392903c37 Melt the butter and oil together in a large skillet. When hot enough for frying, add the floured liver cubes all at once. Gently arrange them with a wooden spoon, so all are in contact with the oil evenly.
aee0b295-2815-47c5-8488-694392903c37 When one side is browned, gently turn spoonfuls of the cubes and brown the other side. While browning you can arrange the cubes with your spoon to turn the uncooked sides, but never stir them too vigorously, or you'll risk losing the flour coating.
aee0b295-2815-47c5-8488-694392903c37 While the liver is cooking, peel and thinly slice the red onion, then cut the slices into quarters. Separate the layers and toss them together with the sumac and chopped parsley, and season with salt.
aee0b295-2815-47c5-8488-694392903c37 To serve, you can make a bed out the onion mixture and spoon the cooked liver on top, or you can serve the onions on the side in a separate bowl. The best side dish to go along with the liver are cubed potatoes that are baked or fried.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Begin by peeling your eggplants. Using a vegetable peeler, begin at one end and remove a strip of peel from end to end. Leave a strip of peel about the same width, then peel another strip from end to end.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Repeat this until your eggplant is peeled in a striped pattern. Peel all eggplant this way.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Slice the eggplants about 1/4 inch thick. Put all the eggplant slices in a large bowl of salty water and let them soak for about 30 minutes. This removes the bitterness.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Slice the green pepper into thin rings. Grate the tomato. Peel and chop the onion finely and fry it in 1 tablespoon of olive oil until tender.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Add the green pepper slices and continue frying until soft. Add the ground beef and fry until browned. Add the grated tomato, tomato paste, and spices.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Cover the pan and let the meat simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Grate the other three tomatoes and put them in a small saucepan.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Add the tomato paste, salt, pepper, oregano, and sugar and let the sauce simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from the heat.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Remove the eggplant slices from the water and blot them dry with paper towels.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Fry them on both sides in vegetable oil until tender and golden brown on both sides. Drain them well on paper towels.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Line the bottom of a large baking tray with the fried eggplant slices to make a single layer. Make sure there are no gaps between the pieces.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Spread the tomato sauce over the eggplant. Next, cover the tomato sauce layer with the meat mixture.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a In a large pan, melt the butter over high heat. Add the flour and turn it around a few times with a wooden spoon.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Add the milk and seasonings and use a wire whisk to make the mixture smooth as it thickens. Your bechamel sauce is ready when it’s the consistency of pudding.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Pour the hot bechamel sauce over the meat layer, covering it completely. Sprinkle the grated cheese evenly over the top of the casserole.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Bake the casserole in a 360 F/180 C oven until the top turns golden brown.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Remove the casserole from the oven and let it rest for at least 10 minutes before cutting it into squares.
27407318-aacf-4e23-a308-62f5e1c4347a Serve your ‘musakka’ with Turkish-style rice pilaf.
5bef744b-1257-4d15-9e27-0898e0222d6f Prepare the eggplant. Using a vegetable peeler or sharp knife, peel alternate strips from the eggplant from end to end leaving a striped pattern. Let the eggplants soak in heavily salted water while you prepare the other ingredients.
5bef744b-1257-4d15-9e27-0898e0222d6f Prepare the filling. Put the olive oil in a large skillet. Fry the onions until they become tender and reduced. Add the ground beef and brown it thoroughly.
5bef744b-1257-4d15-9e27-0898e0222d6f Using a sharp paring knife, peel five of the tomatoes and dice them into cubes. Once the meat is nicely browned, add the cubed tomato and continue stirring. You can also substitute fresh tomatoes with canned, diced tomatoes. Drain off the juice before adding them to the meat.
5bef744b-1257-4d15-9e27-0898e0222d6f Add spices and garlic and stir well. Add the chopped parsley Stir the mixture about three minutes more then turn off the heat and let it rest.
5bef744b-1257-4d15-9e27-0898e0222d6f Drain the eggplants and blot them dry with paper towels. In another skillet, heat the vegetable oil and fry the eggplants whole, turning them to cook evenly on all sides. When the eggplants soften, remove them from the oil and drain them on paper towels.
5bef744b-1257-4d15-9e27-0898e0222d6f Line up the fried eggplants side by side in an oven-proof baking dish. Using your paring knife, cut a slit from end to end of each eggplant and gently open up each one with your fingers.
5bef744b-1257-4d15-9e27-0898e0222d6f Fill the center of each eggplant with the meat mixture. Slice the two extra tomatoes thinly, cut each slice in half and place the slices over the filling. Do the same with the peppers.
5bef744b-1257-4d15-9e27-0898e0222d6f Mix the water with the tomato paste and pour it into the baking dish. Cook the eggplant in a 375 F/200 C oven for about 30 minutes. Remove the dish from the oven and let it rest for a few minutes before serving.
f2dde7c9-d92e-41b1-9161-b3ca0a3a1f46 To make the meat cups, add the ground beef, egg and spices to a mixing bowl. Gently remove the crusts from the stale bread and wet it, squeezing out the extra water. Add the moistened bread to the bowl.
f2dde7c9-d92e-41b1-9161-b3ca0a3a1f46 Wearing rubber gloves, knead all the ingredients together well until it thickens and stiffens, similar to dough. If you have time, cover the top with plastic wrap and let it rest about 15 minutes.
f2dde7c9-d92e-41b1-9161-b3ca0a3a1f46 To make a meat cup, tear off a ball of the meat mixture the size of a golf ball. Make a hole in the center with your finger, then as if you were shaping pottery by hand, use your fingers to lengthen the sides upward and enlarge the hole. Your meat cup should be able to stand up on its own when you place it in the baking pan.
f2dde7c9-d92e-41b1-9161-b3ca0a3a1f46 Set your meat cup in a round or rectangular baking tray. Repeat these steps with rest of the meat mixture until you have filled your baking tray.
f2dde7c9-d92e-41b1-9161-b3ca0a3a1f46 To make the mashed potatoes, peel your potatoes and boil them until very soft. Drain the excess water and mash them with a hand masher while they are still hot. Add the butter and spices and continue to mash.
f2dde7c9-d92e-41b1-9161-b3ca0a3a1f46 Beat them with an electric mixer for several minutes to get rid of the lumps. Slowly add the milk while you continue to beat them until you have a still potato mixture that will hold peaks.
f2dde7c9-d92e-41b1-9161-b3ca0a3a1f46 Using a dessert spoon, fill the centers of each meat cup with a generous portion of the mashed potato. You can also use a cake icing decorator. Make sure you pile the potato high to make peaks on top of each meat cup.
f2dde7c9-d92e-41b1-9161-b3ca0a3a1f46 Sprinkle the top of each potato mound with grated cheese. Bake the ‘köfte’ in a 390 F/200 C oven until the meatballs are cooked and the tops of the potatoes are slightly browned, about 20 minutes.
f2dde7c9-d92e-41b1-9161-b3ca0a3a1f46 Serve your ‘çanak köftesi’ hot along with Turkish rice pilaf with orzo and a salad like Turkish shepherd’s salad.
74c9ef7e-6534-4c77-b4d5-4f5cf8d05001 Gather the ingredients.
74c9ef7e-6534-4c77-b4d5-4f5cf8d05001 Melt the butter together with the oil in a covered skillet or shallow pan. Fry the drained grated onion until tender but not brown - about 5 minutes.
74c9ef7e-6534-4c77-b4d5-4f5cf8d05001 Add the grated tomato and juice and the grated pepper and continue to fry until the vegetables have softened and the liquid is reduced.
74c9ef7e-6534-4c77-b4d5-4f5cf8d05001 Add the bulgur and stir well to combine using a wooden spoon.
74c9ef7e-6534-4c77-b4d5-4f5cf8d05001 Add the salt, pepper, tomato paste, sugar, and broth and stir until combined. Bring the mixture to a boil, then cover and reduce the heat to low.
74c9ef7e-6534-4c77-b4d5-4f5cf8d05001 Let the bulgur simmer gently until all the liquid has been absorbed - about 15 to 20 minutes. Keeping the pan covered, remove it from the heat and set it aside to cool down.
74c9ef7e-6534-4c77-b4d5-4f5cf8d05001 Gently stir the pilaf before serving to make sure all the ingredients are well blended.
74c9ef7e-6534-4c77-b4d5-4f5cf8d05001 Garnish each serving with a piece of fresh or grilled pepper, tomato, and some fresh Italian parsley.
74c9ef7e-6534-4c77-b4d5-4f5cf8d05001 Serve and enjoy!
8a59b01b-3112-4f8f-82a8-da7b224d6262 Gather the ingredients.
8a59b01b-3112-4f8f-82a8-da7b224d6262 In a copper sahan or frying pan, melt the butter completely. Continue to allow the butter to bubble for a few minutes without letting it burn.
8a59b01b-3112-4f8f-82a8-da7b224d6262 Add the cornmeal and work the butter all the way through with a large wooden spoon.
8a59b01b-3112-4f8f-82a8-da7b224d6262 Stir the cornmeal gently over the heat for several minutes until it changes color to a deep golden brown.
8a59b01b-3112-4f8f-82a8-da7b224d6262 When the oil from the butter begins to separate out, add the water and bring it to a boil.
8a59b01b-3112-4f8f-82a8-da7b224d6262 Once the water boils, slowly add the grated cheese.
8a59b01b-3112-4f8f-82a8-da7b224d6262 Stir the mixture well each time to allow the cheese to melt and the mixture to become smooth each time.
8a59b01b-3112-4f8f-82a8-da7b224d6262 As you stir, the melted cheese will combine with the cornmeal.
8a59b01b-3112-4f8f-82a8-da7b224d6262 Let it cook over a low flame, stirring occasionally until you see the butter appear on the top.
8a59b01b-3112-4f8f-82a8-da7b224d6262 Serve hot with fresh, crusty bread to scoop it with and enjoy.
2c4f8206-e2a6-489c-a13b-fa77c0ea97e5 First, cook the pasta in salted water for eight to ten minutes until tender. Drain it and rinse under cold water. Toss it with the vegetable oil the first two cups of the grated cheese in a large mixing bowl. The cheese should have enough salt to season the pasta, but you can add salt and pepper to your taste.
2c4f8206-e2a6-489c-a13b-fa77c0ea97e5 Butter the bottom and sides of a large glass or ceramic baking dish and add the pasta mixture.
2c4f8206-e2a6-489c-a13b-fa77c0ea97e5 To prepare the Bechamel sauce, melt the butter or margarine in a small saucepan. Add the flour and stir until bubbly. Don't let the flour darken or burn.
2c4f8206-e2a6-489c-a13b-fa77c0ea97e5 Turn the heat to low, add the milk and whisk until smooth. Whisk in the salt and pepper and continue whisking until the mixture scalds and begins to thicken. Don't let it boil. Continue until you have a smooth, white sauce. Adjust the salt to your taste.
2c4f8206-e2a6-489c-a13b-fa77c0ea97e5 Pour the hot Bechamel over the pasta and gently turn over the pasta to combine them, if needed. Cover the top of the pasta with the remaining two cups of grated cheese. Bake in a 350 F/ 170 C oven until the dish is firm and the top is golden brown.
2c4f8206-e2a6-489c-a13b-fa77c0ea97e5 Remove the dish from the oven and let it rest about ten minutes before serving. Cut it squares or serve it with a spoon.
5408dde3-2541-4d60-8edb-d31b07849db7 Gather the ingredients.
5408dde3-2541-4d60-8edb-d31b07849db7 In a shallow saucepan, melt the butter and oil together. Once melted, add the orzo and stir continuously over medium heat until the pasta turns a dark golden color. Be careful and keep stirring so the butter and orzo don't burn.
5408dde3-2541-4d60-8edb-d31b07849db7 Add the uncooked rice and stir thoroughly until the oil has worked its way through all the grains. Add your chicken broth and spices and bring to a boil. If you are using chicken bouillon in place of stock, cut down or omit the salt.
5408dde3-2541-4d60-8edb-d31b07849db7 Cover and reduce the heat. Let the rice slowly simmer until the liquid disappears.
5408dde3-2541-4d60-8edb-d31b07849db7 Without removing the cover, take the pan from the heat and put it aside to cool down. Keep the top on at all times while the rice cools. Note: If too much condensation forms on the inside of the lid, open it and cover the top of the pan with a few paper towels, then close the lid over them. This will absorb excess moisture and allow the rice to continue steaming at an even pace.
5408dde3-2541-4d60-8edb-d31b07849db7 Before serving, open the lid and gently stir the rice to loosen the bottom and separate the grains.
5408dde3-2541-4d60-8edb-d31b07849db7 You can use a small dessert bowl as a mold to ​give it that signature rice pilaf look. Fill the bowl and pack in the warm rice with the back of a spoon. Invert the bowl onto a serving plate. The pilaf will pop out in the shape of the bowl. Enjoy!
cea32435-9049-43fa-8336-b39d3de7a5c8 Roast your eggplants on the grill, and remove the pulp. Once you've extracted the flesh and discarded the skin and seeds, use it right away. If not, let the pulp sit in a bowl with some water and lemon juice in it. This prevents the eggplant from darkening.
cea32435-9049-43fa-8336-b39d3de7a5c8 Put your eggplant into a fine wire strainer, and squeeze out any excess liquid. Transfer the pulp to a mixing bowl.
cea32435-9049-43fa-8336-b39d3de7a5c8 Add the olive oil, salt, pepper, and optional crushed garlic.
cea32435-9049-43fa-8336-b39d3de7a5c8 With a fork, whip the mixture until it becomes homogenous, light, and fluffy with no large chunks or strings of eggplant. This can take awhile. You may have to take several breaks in between to rest your arm.
cea32435-9049-43fa-8336-b39d3de7a5c8 Once the puree is ready, you can gently stir in your optional mayonnaise or yogurt. Chill before serving.
cd080d8a-1b94-43bf-8173-e72bc172d515 Gather the ingredients.
cd080d8a-1b94-43bf-8173-e72bc172d515 Place flour and dry yeast in a large bowl, mix to combine.
cd080d8a-1b94-43bf-8173-e72bc172d515 Add the warm water and milk, and combine lightly with a fork.
cd080d8a-1b94-43bf-8173-e72bc172d515 Add the softened butter or margarine and olive oil and combine, as well as the sugar and salt.
cd080d8a-1b94-43bf-8173-e72bc172d515 Knead the dough. You can knead with a mixer or by hand. If you are using a mixer, process the dough for about 10 minutes using the dough kneading hook. If you choose to knead by hand, knead the dough in the bowl for 15 minutes.
cd080d8a-1b94-43bf-8173-e72bc172d515 Turn the dough out onto a floured surface and continue to knead for about five minutes more. The dough should be very soft. If it’s too firm, knead in another tablespoon of olive oil until smooth.
cd080d8a-1b94-43bf-8173-e72bc172d515 Transfer the dough to a plate or bowl, cover with a damp cloth and set aside in a warm place. Allow to rise for about two hours.
cd080d8a-1b94-43bf-8173-e72bc172d515 After the dough has doubled in size, fill a shallow metal baking tray or cookie sheet with water and place it in the bottom rack of the oven. Preheat oven to 430 F/225 C.
cd080d8a-1b94-43bf-8173-e72bc172d515 After two hours, the dough should be about double in size. Remove the cloth and turn it out onto a floured surface. Divide the dough into two pieces with a dough cutter or sharp carving knife.
cd080d8a-1b94-43bf-8173-e72bc172d515 Shape your 2 pide loaves using your fingers. Make each loaf flat and either oval or round, about 1/2 inch thick.
cd080d8a-1b94-43bf-8173-e72bc172d515 Place each loaf on a metal baking tray sprinkled with flour.
cd080d8a-1b94-43bf-8173-e72bc172d515 Using a sharp knife dipped in flour, first cut about 1 inch in from the edge to make a circle all the way around the loaf. Then, inside the circle, make diagonal cuts in opposite directions to make a diamond pattern. Do the same with the other loaf.
cd080d8a-1b94-43bf-8173-e72bc172d515 In a bowl, whisk together the yogurt and egg yolk. Using a pastry brush, coat the top of the loaves generously with the yogurt-egg mixture.
cd080d8a-1b94-43bf-8173-e72bc172d515 Sprinkle the sesame and nigella seeds evenly over the tops.
cd080d8a-1b94-43bf-8173-e72bc172d515 Bake in the preheated oven at 430 F/225 C oven with the water tray for about 30 minutes or until the top becomes deep, golden brown. Serve the pide hot out of the oven.
48460b0e-822a-437b-96c4-7c98039e8f27 Gather the ingredients.
48460b0e-822a-437b-96c4-7c98039e8f27 The night before, put the dry beans in a large bowl and cover them generously with water. Let them soak overnight. The next morning, drain the beans and put them in a pot with fresh water. Let them boil softly until tender. Allow them to cool in the water, then drain them well.
48460b0e-822a-437b-96c4-7c98039e8f27 If you want to save time, substitute the dry beans with canned Navy beans. Drain them and rinse them under cold water before you use them.
48460b0e-822a-437b-96c4-7c98039e8f27 Put the drained beans in a large bowl. Drizzle the vinegar over the top. Cover the bowl with a lid or plastic wrap and let it rest for about one hour.
48460b0e-822a-437b-96c4-7c98039e8f27 In the meantime, chop the tomatoes into small cubes, cut the pepper into rings and chop the parsley. Peel the onion, cut it in half, and cut it into half-circle slices. Wearing rubber gloves, rub the onion slices between your hands or on a wooden cutting board to soften them.
48460b0e-822a-437b-96c4-7c98039e8f27 Drain the extra vinegar from the beans. Toss the chopped vegetables and parsley in with your fingers. Put the beans on a large, flat serving plate or distribute them on individual salad plates. Spread the onion slices evenly over the top.
48460b0e-822a-437b-96c4-7c98039e8f27 For the dressing: mix the lemon juice, olive oil, and salt and pepper together then drizzle it over the salad.
48460b0e-822a-437b-96c4-7c98039e8f27 Garnish the top with black olives, slivers of hard-boiled egg, lemon wedges and parsley sprigs. Sprinkle with hot pepper flakes, if desired.
48460b0e-822a-437b-96c4-7c98039e8f27 Serve and enjoy!
387ce6f1-5723-48dc-8830-494db9ede823 Gather the ingredients.
