387ce6f1-5723-48dc-8830-494db9ede823 Wash and drain all your vegetables and herbs well. Cut the peppers in half and remove the stems, seeds, and white inner membranes. With a sharp dicing blade, dice the peppers as finely as you can.
387ce6f1-5723-48dc-8830-494db9ede823 Peel the tomatoes and remove the watery seed portions from the inside and discard them. Dice the pulp portions in the same manner as the peppers. Do the same with the parsley leaves, onion, and garlic cloves.
387ce6f1-5723-48dc-8830-494db9ede823 Between two sheets of wax paper, crush the walnuts into as fine a powder using a rolling pin.
387ce6f1-5723-48dc-8830-494db9ede823 In a large, shallow dish or tray, mix all the ingredients and spices above together with your fingers. Adjust the salt to your taste. Using a fork, continue to crush the mixture little by little until it is well mashed and blended.
387ce6f1-5723-48dc-8830-494db9ede823 Transfer the mash to your serving dish and garnish it with a sprinkle of sumac powder and fresh sprigs of Italian parsley.
387ce6f1-5723-48dc-8830-494db9ede823 Enjoy!
2ebbd372-a81d-49d6-8c97-fb8133f73bd6 Clean the vegetables and put them into a large saucepan with the water. Boil them gently until very soft. Drain them, then add the cooked chickpeas and puree the mixture in a blender or food processor. If the mixture seems too watery, let it sit in a very fine wire strainer for a few minutes to let excess water drip away.
2ebbd372-a81d-49d6-8c97-fb8133f73bd6 Put the warm vegetable puree into a large mixing bowl. Add the yogurt and mix thoroughly. Mix in the active dry yeast and spices.
2ebbd372-a81d-49d6-8c97-fb8133f73bd6 Now begin adding flour very slowly and working it completely into the mixture with your hands. Continue this process until all the flour is mixed in evenly and you have a smooth batter.
2ebbd372-a81d-49d6-8c97-fb8133f73bd6 Cover the top of the bowl with some cling wrap and a towel and set it in a warm place for 5 days. Check the batter every day and stir it to keep the fermentation even.
2ebbd372-a81d-49d6-8c97-fb8133f73bd6 On the 5th day, remove the towel and cling wrap and stir the mixture well. It should have a sour aroma and be bright orange in color.
2ebbd372-a81d-49d6-8c97-fb8133f73bd6 Divide the batter up by placing large spoonfuls on baking sheets covered with non-stick baking parchment. Leave the sheets in a dry place until one side of the patties are completely dry. Flip them over and allow the other side to dry.
2ebbd372-a81d-49d6-8c97-fb8133f73bd6 After the patties look dry, you can begin to break them apart with your fingers. The centers will still be moist, so allow more time for the coarsely crumbled tarhana to dry further.
2ebbd372-a81d-49d6-8c97-fb8133f73bd6 Repeat the crumbling and drying process several times until the pieces are small enough to put through a food processor or fine sieve.
2ebbd372-a81d-49d6-8c97-fb8133f73bd6 Once you have a lot of fine powder, spread it out on the trays and continue to dry it, shifting the powder with your hands occasionally.
2ebbd372-a81d-49d6-8c97-fb8133f73bd6 In the end, you should have a fine pulse that is completely dry. As long as you’re sure it’s dried thoroughly, you can store the pulse in glass containers for more than 1 year with no refrigeration needed.
2ebbd372-a81d-49d6-8c97-fb8133f73bd6 To make tarhana soup, simply cook a few tablespoons of the pulse in hot milk or water until it thickens, and add butter, salt, and spices to taste.
1daf3e2c-4a57-4b9b-8079-82d0f0d3664f Prepare the eggplant: cut off both ends and using the edge of a vegetable peeler or a paring knife, remove the skin in alternating strips going from top to bottom. Do this gently, saving as much flesh as you can.
1daf3e2c-4a57-4b9b-8079-82d0f0d3664f Cut the eggplant into bite-sized rectangular chunks about 2 inches long. Put the chunks of eggplant in a large mesh strainer or colander and salt well, turning with your hands to salt all sides. Let the salted eggplant rest for about 15 minutes while you prepare the other vegetables. This removes the bitterness.
1daf3e2c-4a57-4b9b-8079-82d0f0d3664f Coarsely dice the peppers, red onion, and squash.
1daf3e2c-4a57-4b9b-8079-82d0f0d3664f Once the vegetables are ready, pour about two inches of oil in a deep frying pan or saucepan and turn the heat on high. While the oil is heating, wash the eggplant in the strainer with cold water, turning it with your hands, until the salt is removed. Drain it well and blot off the extra water with paper towels before you fry them.
1daf3e2c-4a57-4b9b-8079-82d0f0d3664f Fry the eggplant until tender and just beginning to brown at the edges. Do the same with the squash. Strain out the fried vegetables and drain them on a thick layer of paper towels. Let them sit for several minutes to make sure as much oil as possible drains away.
1daf3e2c-4a57-4b9b-8079-82d0f0d3664f In the meantime, put two tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet and fry the onions, garlic, and peppers until tender.
1daf3e2c-4a57-4b9b-8079-82d0f0d3664f Add the tomatoes, tomato paste, sugar, salt, and pepper. Cover and reduce the heat to low. Let the sauce simmer until the tomatoes are soft and begin to break down.
1daf3e2c-4a57-4b9b-8079-82d0f0d3664f Remove the lid, stir it well, and let the sauce simmer until most of the liquid is reduced. It should be the consistency of jarred pasta sauce.
1daf3e2c-4a57-4b9b-8079-82d0f0d3664f In a mixing bowl, add the eggplant, squash, and tomato sauce and stir together well. Put the şakşuka in a serving dish and chill for several hours. Just before serving, spoon generous amounts of garlic yogurt over the top.
96341780-1e61-407e-8357-c9df52fddffd If you are using fresh okra, trim the rough stems from the ends of the pods and remove the thin membrane covering the stem end. Handle them gently as not to damage them. Rinse them several times in a wire strainer under ice cold water, turning them with your hands.
96341780-1e61-407e-8357-c9df52fddffd Drain them and let them soak in one cup of vinegar for about 30 minutes. Wash them again to remove all the vinegar. Repeat this process once more.
96341780-1e61-407e-8357-c9df52fddffd After your okra soaks in vinegar and is rinsed the second time, it's ready to use. If you're using frozen okra, it's ready to use right out of the bag.
96341780-1e61-407e-8357-c9df52fddffd Peel the onion and coarsely chop it. Heat the two tablespoons of olive oil in a medium saucepan and fry the onions until tender and reduced. Add the fresh or frozen okra.
96341780-1e61-407e-8357-c9df52fddffd Wash and peel your tomato. Dice it into small cubes and add it to the pan. Add the lemon juice, salt, pepper, and sugar and turn the mixture around gently with a large wooden spoon.
96341780-1e61-407e-8357-c9df52fddffd Add the water, bring it to a boil, reduce the heat to low and cover. Let the okra simmer gently. The amount of liquid in the pan will increase as the vegetables release their own juice; you should simmer them until the okra are very tender and the liquid is almost gone.
96341780-1e61-407e-8357-c9df52fddffd Test your okra a few times while cooking. If they are tender but there is still a lot of liquid, remove the lid so the liquid evaporates more quickly.
96341780-1e61-407e-8357-c9df52fddffd When the okra is tender and the liquid is almost gone, turn off the heat and let the pan cool down to room temperature. Transfer the okra to your serving platter.
96341780-1e61-407e-8357-c9df52fddffd Drizzle the 1/3 cup of olive oil over the top of the dish. You can serve the okra room temperature or cover and refrigerate it before serving.
317dc1ee-a236-4613-a3c9-e4a55ad55355 In a large bowl, melt the butter in the microwave. Next, stir in the milk, salt, and pepper. Microwave again on high until the milk is warm but not scalding.
317dc1ee-a236-4613-a3c9-e4a55ad55355 In a separate bowl, toss together the crumbled white cheese and chopped parsley.
317dc1ee-a236-4613-a3c9-e4a55ad55355 Butter the bottom and sides of a large, oven-proof baking tray. Drizzle a spoonful or two of the milk mixture over the bottom. Next, take the first sheet of yufka and place it in an uneven, wrinkly fashion to cover the bottom of the tray. Spoon about 1/6 of the milk mixture all over the yufka. Let it run into the cracks and crevices and around the edges.
317dc1ee-a236-4613-a3c9-e4a55ad55355 Divide the cheese mixture roughly into five parts. Sprinkle 1/5 of the cheese mixture over the yufka. Now, do the same with the next layer. Repeat until you have five layers finished. Cover the top of your pastry completely with the last piece of yufka. Drizzle the last portion of the milk mixture over the top, wetting all of it.
317dc1ee-a236-4613-a3c9-e4a55ad55355 Sprinkle the top of your pastry with sesame seeds or nigella seeds. Bake it in a 185 F/365 C oven for about 45 minutes, or until the top is nicely browned and the center is firm.
317dc1ee-a236-4613-a3c9-e4a55ad55355 When your pastry is cooked, remove the pan from oven and sprinkle one or two tablespoons of cold water over the top, then wrap the whole thing in clean butcher's paper or a clean towel. This helps to soften the top layer. Let the pastry rest for about 20 minutes before cutting it into squares.
7ee946f3-2eaa-4983-9fba-f58739911ff3 First, peel and dice your onion and garlic and put them in a covered saucepan along with 3 tbsp. of olive oil. Saute the onion and garlic until they're soft and reduced.
7ee946f3-2eaa-4983-9fba-f58739911ff3 Add the beans, carrots, grated tomato, tomato paste, sugar, and spices. Add enough water to just cover the beans and stir until combined.
7ee946f3-2eaa-4983-9fba-f58739911ff3 Bring the mixture to a boil, then cover and reduce the heat to low. Let the beans simmer gently until much of the water is reduced and the beans and carrots are tender.
7ee946f3-2eaa-4983-9fba-f58739911ff3 When the beans are tender, turn off the heat and let the pan cool down. After it cools, spoon the beans gently onto your serving plate. Drizzle the olive oil evenly over the top.
7ee946f3-2eaa-4983-9fba-f58739911ff3 Cover with cling wrap and chill until ready to serve.
7ee946f3-2eaa-4983-9fba-f58739911ff3 Just before serving, sprinkle the top with your chopped Italian parsley leaves for garnish.
a8059f5c-2b99-4e25-82f8-8b1fd2b88a21 First, place the softened butter or margarine in a large mixing bowl and whip with an electric mixer on the lowest setting until creamy.
a8059f5c-2b99-4e25-82f8-8b1fd2b88a21 Add the flour. Wearing rubber gloves, work the flour into the butter with your fingers until combined. Add the powdered sugar, vanilla, baking powder, and semolina and continue working them in with your fingers until the dough has a smooth consistency. The warmth from your hands will help melt the butter and soften the mixture as you work.
a8059f5c-2b99-4e25-82f8-8b1fd2b88a21 In the meantime, start the syrup. Add 4 cups of boiling water to a saucepan. Add the granulated sugar and the half lemon. Bring to a boil then gently simmer uncovered for about 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat and let it cool down just a bit.
a8059f5c-2b99-4e25-82f8-8b1fd2b88a21 Next, add the eggs to the dough mixture and knead them into the dough until smooth.
a8059f5c-2b99-4e25-82f8-8b1fd2b88a21 With your hands, pinch off a piece of dough and roll it into a ball about the size of an apricot. Place it on an ungreased metal oven tray. Continue making even-sized balls and lining them up side by side, leaving some space in between.
a8059f5c-2b99-4e25-82f8-8b1fd2b88a21 Gently press down on the top of each ball to flatten it slightly. Press an almond or a hazelnut into the center of each.
a8059f5c-2b99-4e25-82f8-8b1fd2b88a21 Bake in a 160C or 320F oven for 20 to 25 minutes until the tops of your cookies are golden brown.
a8059f5c-2b99-4e25-82f8-8b1fd2b88a21 Remove your tray from the oven and, while it is still hot, pour the warm syrup evenly over the top.
a8059f5c-2b99-4e25-82f8-8b1fd2b88a21 Let the tray cool down to room temperature. As they cool, the cookies will absorb the syrup and get soft.
a8059f5c-2b99-4e25-82f8-8b1fd2b88a21 When the şekerpare are cool, they are ready to serve. Serve two or three on a decorative plate and garnish them with a spoonful of Turkish clotted cream, called "kaymak" if you wish.
eafce03a-671a-42c1-a337-c94f3a7eaf73 Preheat the oven to 350 F (175 C). Grease a 9-inch by 13-inch baking pan.
eafce03a-671a-42c1-a337-c94f3a7eaf73 Before you start making the cake, prepare the syrup to give it time to cool down. Begin by mixing the sugar and water in a medium saucepan. Turn the heat on high and bring the mixture to a boil while continuously stirring it.
eafce03a-671a-42c1-a337-c94f3a7eaf73 Once it boils, reduce the heat to low and let the syrup boil gently for about 10 minutes with the cover off. Add the lemon juice toward the end. Turn off the heat and let the syrup cool down while you make the rest of the recipe.
eafce03a-671a-42c1-a337-c94f3a7eaf73 In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the eggs and sugar. Whisk the mixture briskly for several minutes until the sugar dissolves. The more you whisk, the better your revani will turn out.
eafce03a-671a-42c1-a337-c94f3a7eaf73 Add the oil, lemon zest, vanilla, and yogurt and whisk for several minutes more.
eafce03a-671a-42c1-a337-c94f3a7eaf73 Add the dry ingredients and mix together well until you have a smooth batter.
eafce03a-671a-42c1-a337-c94f3a7eaf73 Pour the batter into the greased baking pan. Bake until the top is nicely browned and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 30 to 40 minutes. Once you remove the pan from the oven, let it rest for about 5 minutes.
eafce03a-671a-42c1-a337-c94f3a7eaf73 Cut the cake into portion-sized squares or rectangles while still in the pan.
eafce03a-671a-42c1-a337-c94f3a7eaf73 Using a large spoon, slowly drizzle all of the cooled syrup over the cake and let it soak in. Cover the cake with foil and refrigerate it for several hours.
eafce03a-671a-42c1-a337-c94f3a7eaf73 Before serving, garnish each square of cake with a pinch of coconut and ground nuts.
92c529ef-2185-4c6f-9c48-b439801b3803 Gather the ingredients.
92c529ef-2185-4c6f-9c48-b439801b3803 Make the syrup. In a saucepan, stir the 3 1/2 cups and 3 cups sugar water together. Bring the mixture to a boil and stir until the sugar is dissolved.
92c529ef-2185-4c6f-9c48-b439801b3803 Reduce the heat and let the syrup simmer gently for about 15 minutes. Add the lemon juice and simmer for 1 minute longer. Turn off the heat and let it cool.
92c529ef-2185-4c6f-9c48-b439801b3803 Make the batter. In a saucepan, add the 2 cups water, butter, and 2 tablespoons sugar. Turn on the heat and stir continuously until the butter is melted.
92c529ef-2185-4c6f-9c48-b439801b3803 Stir in the flour using a wooden spoon until a loose dough forms. When the dough begins to collect around the spoon, remove the pan from the heat.
92c529ef-2185-4c6f-9c48-b439801b3803 Break one egg at a time into the dough and stir them in with the wooden spoon.
92c529ef-2185-4c6f-9c48-b439801b3803 Add the semolina and cornstarch, combining well with the wooden spoon.
92c529ef-2185-4c6f-9c48-b439801b3803 Transfer batter to a pastry bag fitted with a star tip.
92c529ef-2185-4c6f-9c48-b439801b3803 Pour about 3 inches of vegetable oil into a deep frying pan and heat to 350 F, checking it with a thermometer.
92c529ef-2185-4c6f-9c48-b439801b3803 Once the oil is hot, squeeze out small lines of dough directly into the hot oil. Use a strainer or spoon to turn the pieces over and around so they brown evenly.
92c529ef-2185-4c6f-9c48-b439801b3803 When the tulumba are evenly browned, remove them from the oil and drain on paper towels.
92c529ef-2185-4c6f-9c48-b439801b3803 Add them to the cool syrup and let them soak it up for a few minutes.
92c529ef-2185-4c6f-9c48-b439801b3803 Arrange the syrupy sweets on a serving plate and pour some extra syrup over the top. You can garnish the tulumba with ground nuts if you wish.
952c4cb9-8f7f-49a3-8c59-8460bc98367f The most difficult part of this recipe is the first step―trimming your pumpkin. To begin, cut the top off your pumpkin like a small cap. In the same fashion, cut off the stem at the very bottom.
952c4cb9-8f7f-49a3-8c59-8460bc98367f Using a sturdy, sharp carving knife, cut the pumpkin from top to bottom making slivers about 2 inches wide at the center.
952c4cb9-8f7f-49a3-8c59-8460bc98367f Clean out the seeds and soft middle portions and cut off the outer skin of each sliver. Now you should have several crescent-shaped slivers of pumpkin.
952c4cb9-8f7f-49a3-8c59-8460bc98367f Depending on their length, cut each sliver into two or three pieces. Your goal should be pieces three to four inches long.
952c4cb9-8f7f-49a3-8c59-8460bc98367f Line the bottom of a large, shallow covered skillet or saucepan with the pumpkin.
952c4cb9-8f7f-49a3-8c59-8460bc98367f Pour the sugar evenly over the top. Sprinkle the pinch of salt over the top, add the cinnamon sticks and cover the pan. Let the pan rest overnight.
952c4cb9-8f7f-49a3-8c59-8460bc98367f The next morning, you'll see that the pumpkin has released all its juices. The pumpkin pieces should be nearly covered in their own juice. There should be no need to add any extra water.
952c4cb9-8f7f-49a3-8c59-8460bc98367f Place the plan still covered on the stove and bring it to a boil, then reduce the heat.
952c4cb9-8f7f-49a3-8c59-8460bc98367f Let the pumpkin simmer until it becomes very soft and translucent and the juice and sugar are reduced to a thick, syrupy consistency. This can take from one to even two hours. Check the pan frequently to prevent the sugar from burning.
952c4cb9-8f7f-49a3-8c59-8460bc98367f Once the pumpkin is "candied," let it cool down in the pan for several minutes. Remove the pieces gently and arrange them on your serving platter.
952c4cb9-8f7f-49a3-8c59-8460bc98367f Discard the cinnamon sticks. Drizzle the extra syrup over the top and refrigerate for several hours.
952c4cb9-8f7f-49a3-8c59-8460bc98367f Just before serving, garnish your pumpkin pieces with crushed walnuts and a dollop of Turkish 'kaymak,' or clotted cream.
952c4cb9-8f7f-49a3-8c59-8460bc98367f If you want to spice up your candied pumpkin, you can add whole cloves, cardamom, pieces of ginger and nutmeg to the juice along with the cinnamon sticks before cooking.
5f756d38-6354-497b-8a7d-484f5af10c35 Put the water in a saucepan and bring it to a boil. Add the sugar and stir until dissolved.
5f756d38-6354-497b-8a7d-484f5af10c35 Add the citric acid and continue to boil the sugar until it darkens and stiffens to the consistency of thick honey. Remove the pan from the heat.
5f756d38-6354-497b-8a7d-484f5af10c35 Add the tahini to the thickened sugar. Using a wooden spoon, stir the mixture by scraping the sides and bring it to the center.
5f756d38-6354-497b-8a7d-484f5af10c35 Repeat this motion evenly all around the pot, always kneading the mixture toward the center. When you have a smooth texture, add the optional nuts and mix through.
5f756d38-6354-497b-8a7d-484f5af10c35 Press the mixture into a square or rectangular dish. Let it cool down to room temperature. Cut the helva into squares and serve. You can garnish each serving with additional chopped nuts if you like.
6b7d1098-74e7-4f87-b4bf-430b8d8d5e31 Before you begin, you must boil your chestnuts until tender. To do this, using a sturdy, sharp knife, slice into the outer hull crosswise each chestnut making a slit deep enough to penetrate the inner hull as well.
6b7d1098-74e7-4f87-b4bf-430b8d8d5e31 Put the chestnuts in a large saucepan and fill it with water to cover the chestnuts well. Bring to a boil and let the chestnuts boil with a cracked lid for about 20 minutes or until they are very tender.
6b7d1098-74e7-4f87-b4bf-430b8d8d5e31 When the chestnuts are tender, drain them and run them under cold water until they are cool enough to handle. Use the paring knife to remove the outer shell and the inner brown membrane. Be careful to remove all the membrane not leaving any small pieces.
6b7d1098-74e7-4f87-b4bf-430b8d8d5e31 First , put two cups of boiled, peeled chestnuts, powdered sugar and 2 tbsp. of heavy cream in a food processor and pulse on high until well blended.
6b7d1098-74e7-4f87-b4bf-430b8d8d5e31 Continue to add cream little by little, processing each time, until you have a dough-like puree that doesn't stick to your hands. Remove the puree from the mixer, form it into a ball and let it rest in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
6b7d1098-74e7-4f87-b4bf-430b8d8d5e31 Melt the bitter chocolate in a double boiler or in a microwave oven. Gently whisk one tbsp. of heavy cream into to melted chocolate.
6b7d1098-74e7-4f87-b4bf-430b8d8d5e31 Break off pieces of the chestnut puree and form them into balls the size of chestnuts. Roll them in the melted chocolate to cover all sides with the help of a fork. Place each ball on a tray covered with wax paper. Garnish one side or the top of each ball with ground pistachio nuts before the chocolate hardens.
6b7d1098-74e7-4f87-b4bf-430b8d8d5e31 Place the tray in the refrigerator for at least 20 minutes before serving to allow the chocolate to set.
6b7d1098-74e7-4f87-b4bf-430b8d8d5e31 If you don't like working with melted chocolate, you can also roll your karyoka in cocoa powder to coat them.
6b7d1098-74e7-4f87-b4bf-430b8d8d5e31 For serving, you can place each candy in a small paper confection cup or arrange them on a fancy serving dish. A chocolate chestnut or two goes very well with coffee and boxes of them make wonderful gifts.
268227fe-609a-430d-8b44-be75e30d13c2 Gather the ingredients.
268227fe-609a-430d-8b44-be75e30d13c2 Grease the sides and bottom of a 9-inch baking pan with butter or shortening. Line with wax paper and then grease the wax paper as well.
268227fe-609a-430d-8b44-be75e30d13c2 In a saucepan, combine 1 1/2 cups of water, the granulated sugar, and lemon juice over medium heat. Stir constantly until the sugar dissolves.
268227fe-609a-430d-8b44-be75e30d13c2 Allow the mixture to boil. Then reduce the heat to low and allow it to simmer until the mixture reaches 240 F on a candy thermometer. Remove from the heat and set aside.
268227fe-609a-430d-8b44-be75e30d13c2 Combine 1 cup of cornstarch, cream of tartar, and the remaining 2 3/4 cups water in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir until all the lumps are gone and the mixture begins to boil. Stop stirring when the mixture has a glue-like consistency.​
268227fe-609a-430d-8b44-be75e30d13c2 Stir in the sugar and lemon juice mixture. Stir constantly for about 5 minutes. Reduce the heat to low, and allow the mixture to simmer for 1 hour, stirring frequently.
268227fe-609a-430d-8b44-be75e30d13c2 Once the mixture has become a golden color, stir in the rosewater. Pour the mixture into the prepared pan. Spread evenly and allow to cool overnight.
268227fe-609a-430d-8b44-be75e30d13c2 Once it has cooled overnight, sift together the confectioners' sugar and the remaining 1/4 cup cornstarch.
268227fe-609a-430d-8b44-be75e30d13c2 Turn over the baking pan containing the Turkish delight onto a clean counter or table and cut with an oiled knife into one-inch pieces.
268227fe-609a-430d-8b44-be75e30d13c2 Coat with the confectioners' sugar mixture. Serve or store in an airtight container in layers separated with wax or parchment paper.
4de8ca73-0186-4ff3-ae95-503c861b584c If you are using ready "ekmek kadayıfı," you have to wet it down first with boiling water to soften it. Begin by placing the "kadayıf" browned-side-down in a shallow, round tray of the same size. Pour enough boiling water over the bread to cover it, and let it rest for 15 minutes.
4de8ca73-0186-4ff3-ae95-503c861b584c When time is up, remove the wet bread, and place it on a clean towel or a thick layer of folded paper towels.
4de8ca73-0186-4ff3-ae95-503c861b584c Wring out the extra water by pressing down on the bread evenly. Let it rest on the towel for a few minutes. Discard the water in the tray and put the moistened bread back inside.
4de8ca73-0186-4ff3-ae95-503c861b584c Using a sharp knife, cut a large cross shape at the center of the moistened bread. This will help the syrup penetrate. Place the metal tray on the stove over low heat. Slowly drizzle the syrup over the top. Turn the tray around over the burner to help the bread absorb the syrup evenly.
4de8ca73-0186-4ff3-ae95-503c861b584c Put the sugar in a large pan, and let it melt slowly over medium heat. Let it caramelize until it turns a dark honey color. Add the water, and bring it to a boil.
4de8ca73-0186-4ff3-ae95-503c861b584c Once it boils, add the lemon juice. Let the syrup simmer gently for about 10 minutes then turn off the heat. The syrup should be thick and the color of light honey.
4de8ca73-0186-4ff3-ae95-503c861b584c All the bread should become saturated with the syrup which will cause it to darken. When all the syrup is completely absorbed, remove the tray from the heat, and let it cool down.
4de8ca73-0186-4ff3-ae95-503c861b584c To serve, cut the "ekmek kadayıfı" in squares or triangles. The traditional way to garnish it is to put a thick layer of clotted cream between two layers of bread, but you can also put it on top instead. Sprinkle the top of the dessert with crushed nuts.
b59430ff-6091-415f-8d7c-517952c1b66b Combine the sugar, milk, and water in a saucepan and bring it to a boil. Stir it occasionally until the sugar is dissolved then turn off the heat. If you decide to add optional flavoring like vanilla, rose water or lemon zest, stir it into the hot milk mixture.
b59430ff-6091-415f-8d7c-517952c1b66b Melt the butter in a large, shallow pan. When the butter is bubbly, add the flour all at once. Work the butter all the way through the flour using a wooden spoon.
b59430ff-6091-415f-8d7c-517952c1b66b Reduce the heat to low. Stir the flour and butter mixture by turning it over with the wooden spoon. Do this continuously over very low heat for at least 15 minutes. The flour should slowly turn golden brown and take on a toasted aroma. Make sure to turn the mixture over evenly and be care not to let it brown too quickly.
b59430ff-6091-415f-8d7c-517952c1b66b When the flour is ready, turn off the heat. Add the milk and sugar mixture all at once and let it bubble up. Stir the liquid through the flour as it's bubbling. Continue to stir the mixture as it cools down. The helva will begin to bind together and form a ball. It should be soft but firm and take on a shiny texture.
b59430ff-6091-415f-8d7c-517952c1b66b While the ball of helva is still hot, you can shape it as you wish. You can use a large spoon to make oval-shaped individual helva, or you can press the helva down in a shallow serving dish. When it's cool, you can cut it into squares.
b59430ff-6091-415f-8d7c-517952c1b66b Toast the pine nuts by turning them over in a small, non-stick pan over high heat. Press a pine nut on the top of each 'spoon' helva, or press them evenly in a pattern over the top of flat helva.
a5776fba-f9b6-4f8f-9345-c11001948193 Gather the ingredients. Preheat the oven to 350 F / 180 C.
a5776fba-f9b6-4f8f-9345-c11001948193 In a colander, rinse the rice until the water runs clear.
a5776fba-f9b6-4f8f-9345-c11001948193 In a large saucepan, add the rice and enough water to cover it by about 1/2 inch.
a5776fba-f9b6-4f8f-9345-c11001948193 Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat. Let the rice simmer gently until it's softened, about 5 minutes.
a5776fba-f9b6-4f8f-9345-c11001948193 Add 3 3/4 cups milk, the sugar, and vanilla extract to the rice. Bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce the heat and let it boil very gently for about 10 minutes.
a5776fba-f9b6-4f8f-9345-c11001948193 In a small bowl, use a whisk to mix 1 cup of milk and the cornstarch until smooth.
a5776fba-f9b6-4f8f-9345-c11001948193 While stirring, gradually pour the milk-cornstarch mixture into the rice.
a5776fba-f9b6-4f8f-9345-c11001948193 Turn up the heat and continue stirring the pudding until scalding.
a5776fba-f9b6-4f8f-9345-c11001948193 When the pudding thickens, continue to stir and cook for about 2 minutes more.
a5776fba-f9b6-4f8f-9345-c11001948193 Remove from the heat and fill small, ovenproof dessert cups, clay cups, or disposable aluminum pudding cups with the hot mixture.
a5776fba-f9b6-4f8f-9345-c11001948193 In a small bowl, beat the egg yolk with the remaining 3 tablespoons of milk.
a5776fba-f9b6-4f8f-9345-c11001948193 Using a spoon, drizzle a small amount of the egg-milk mixture into the center of each dessert cup.
a5776fba-f9b6-4f8f-9345-c11001948193 With the back of the spoon, use a light, circular motion to swirl the egg yolk from the center to the edges so it spreads evenly over the top of each cup.
a5776fba-f9b6-4f8f-9345-c11001948193 Bake the pudding cups until the tops are nicely browned, about 20 minutes.
a5776fba-f9b6-4f8f-9345-c11001948193 Let the cups cool at room temperature and then refrigerate for several hours before serving. Enjoy.
f1040730-67a0-4e5d-bdeb-ea22d566ff20 Begin by washing the rice in a wire strainer under cold, running water for several minutes until the water runs clear. Once it's washed and drained, put the rice in a large saucepan. Add water to the pan to cover the rice about ½ inch. Bring the water to a boil, cover the pan, turn the heat to low and cook the rice for about 20 minutes.
f1040730-67a0-4e5d-bdeb-ea22d566ff20 Put the 4 ½ cups water in a separate saucepan. Add the saffron and let it soak for about 15 minutes. After it softens, use the edge of a wooden spoon to crush the saffron and release the yellow color.
f1040730-67a0-4e5d-bdeb-ea22d566ff20 Add the cooked rice, sugar and turmeric to the saffron and water and bring it to a boil. Add the rose water and cornstarch and cook, stirring continuously for about 20 minutes until the pudding thickens and becomes a clear yellow color.
f1040730-67a0-4e5d-bdeb-ea22d566ff20 Turn off the heat and leave the pudding to cool in the pan about 10 minutes.
f1040730-67a0-4e5d-bdeb-ea22d566ff20 Fill your dessert cups or a large serving bowl with the pudding. Let it cool to room temperature. Refrigerate for several hours.
f1040730-67a0-4e5d-bdeb-ea22d566ff20 Serve your 'zerde' cold. Garnish it with more pine nuts, and dried currants that have been soaked for a few minutes in hot water. You can also use other toppings like ground coconut, crushed pistachio nuts, and fresh pomegranate seeds.
